Review:
I needed another carseat for my toddler so my 8 month old could have the seat she has currently been using. My toddler now rides in a Britax Boulevard. I love the Britax brand for its safety, but the price is just really steep. So I decided to look for a carseat without the Britax name.

First of all, I will say that the carseat has a lot of awesome features! It has a built in cupholder, armrests, and comfy foam seating. It is also an excellent price!

The problem was...my daughter is bigger than the average 2 year old. She isn't huge, but she's kind of stocky. She will be 2 in about 2 weeks and she weighs 33lbs. She is a little above average height. I wanted her to be able to stay in a 5pt harness, but still get the added features of a big girl seat. So off to Target I went. The display model stated the seat could be used from 2yrs +. After much debate, I purchased it. I had read on several other reviews here on Amazon that the seat had a small flaw...the crotch strap. I really hoped this wouldn't be the case with us, but as other reviewers stated, it definitely posed a problem for us. The crotch strap was digging into her legs and if she grows much more it won't work at all. However, when we opened the box, it stated 3yrs+ on the instructions. I can't possibly imagine my daughter being able to use the 5pt harness at age 3, but maybe it's because she's above average for weight.

We're taking it back. Had the strap worked, we would definitely keep it!

Review:
I’m going to try my best to explain this...but here is my review on the Safety 1st Jive Convertible car seat.

I purchased this car seat to put in my moms truck as a rear facing car seat until Posey is flipped front facing. I installed it in my car to begin with so I could make sure it was set up properly and ready to go before we made our trip to North Dakota. I noticed there was a slight issue when I put it in my car but figured it was because I did it quick. So I took it to my moms and installed it in her truck for the trip. Thought all was good and we started our journey. We stopped to get gas the first time and noticed Posey was leaning further back and the level line was no longer level to the ground. Figured I did it wrong again and just reinstalled the seat and continued going. Stopped for gas again and the seat was leaning backwards again. So again I adjusted it and went about our way. When we made it to our destination I made a comment to my mom that the seat just wasn’t securing the right way. Pulled the book out and made sure I did everything as it states and I had. So we just went about our trip. Then we moved the kids seats from my moms truck to my sisters truck and I could not for the life of me get it to sit properly rear faced. So I turned her front facing against my own judgement because it was secure and felt safer then putting her in it rear facing. I felt better about it if she sat front facing then rear at this point because clearly something was off with the seat. We went to leave and head back to California and I installed it in my moms truck again and it just wouldn’t secure right. So I rolled up a blanket and put it underneath it hoping that would help. And it didn’t... so we put her front facing again which in turn caused her to get carsick and vomit all over. So I rolled those blankets back up and flipped her back around and drove home. I wrote the company an email about my concerns and hadn’t heard back. But it just wasn’t sitting well with me. So I called them today and they pulled my email up and spent 30 minutes FaceTiming me to ensure that I was installing the seat correctly. Which I was. They called another employee in to watch me install and tighten the seat into the car. I showed them how easily it pushes backwards and how she would wind up laying on her back just about in the car. They told me the seat isn’t compatible with my car. I told them I have installed this specific seat in not one, but three different vehicles and it does it in all three. They said that it must not be compatible with any of them. I looked on their website to find a compatible car seat list and couldn’t find one. Also read reviews on amazon and their website stating the same issue I’m having. They ended up issuing me a refund and having me destroy this seat and will ‘look into’ others to see if they are having the same issue. I’m not sure how I feel about that but I hope this post sways some people on purchasing this and saves a babies life. Because even the lady on the phone from the company said the seat should not push backwards so far that the baby is laying on their back. Your child should not be able to push their feet on the back seat and move the car seat backwards. Ever. And that was the point I was trying to prove to them. I’m not sure if they even believe me. But by golly I will not purchase another seat from them.

Review:
Have not had this seat long, but love it so far. Super comfy for my daughter and I feel that she is really well-protected.

Quick tip regarding the click-tight, which I didn't feel was clear in the manual: don't over-tighten the seat belt or latch belt!

If you are coming from any other type of seat, you're probably used to threading the belt and then pulling as hard as possible to get that sucker tight enough. The way the ClickTight is designed to work, is the frame puts extra pressure on the belt as it closes, creating that tension for you. The first time I tried to install, I saw right away why other reviewers have had issues with getting the seat to open back up again (even having to resort to pliers). If the belt is too tight, you have to force the seat closed and then it is nearly impossible to open again. What worked best for me was to just thread the belt through, removing any slack but not pulling it taut. Then close the seat - it should close with one firm push, you shouldn't have to force it - if you're struggling, try actually LOOSENING the belt a little. Once closed, THEN do the wiggle test and hopefully it should be rock solid. I'm really satisfied with the system, and hope that tip helps other people like it better, too!
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: ClickTight, seat belt, latch belt, threading the belt, pulling to tighten, belt too tight, loosen the belt, wiggle test
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The car seat should be easy to install using a ClickTight system. It should also be installable using the vehicle's seat belt or LATCH belt. The installation process should involve threading the belt and pulling to tighten it securely. It is acceptable if the belt can sometimes feel too tight during installation, as long as it can be loosened if needed. The installed seat should pass a wiggle test to confirm it is secure.

Review: We are pregnant with our first child and currently drive a Mini Cooper. We will be buying a second car sometime in the months after our baby is born, but we wanted a car seat that would fit in the back of both the Mini and a 4-door car. We did our research and decided on the Chicco Keyfit because the reviews said it was compact and easy to install, a must when you are dealing with a cramped back seat. The Chicco did not disappoint. It is very easy to install, and I even have enough leg room to be comfortable in the passenger seat! I also like that the straps are easy to adjust from the front of the car seat for when our baby is wearing bulkier clothes. I was a bit worried about the Chicco because some of the Keyfit reviews I read said the car seat had a horrible chemically smell that wouldn't go away. I can't speak for all of the different fabrics and designs, but the red one (Fuego) we bought does not have this problem. My only issue with the car seat is that the carrier is a bit heavy. I will have to beef up to carry my baby around in it. I suppose that is a good incentive to improve my upper body strength, which I really should do anyway.

Review:
This car seat has met our needs very well. Our child became to big for his infant seat at 7 months so we needed a car seat that could still grow with him i.e. front and rear facing. He sustained a neck injury at birth so comfort was also a concern but we didn't have the money to spend on a Britax.

I love this seat because:

* Most everything on the car seat is straightforward and easy to use
* In rear facing there are 3 adjustable recline settings
* In forward facing 2 adjustable recline settings are available. We still use the most recline we can to help with sleeping in the car and all around comfort.
* 5 point harness fits snug and secure
* Harness buckles are not too tight and difficult to use like some cheaper car seat models we have tried.
* Though the built in pillow doesn't prevent his head from slouching to the side during sleep it offers a nice padded and safe wedge to hold his head up when a blanket roll is placed beneath it.
* He is very comfortable in the seat.
* The shoulder straps adjust as needed for the child's growth but also remain snug even though they are adjustable.
* Safe up to 50 Lb.

Improvements could be made on:
* The shoulder straps by the neck have no padding and can become abrasive the the baby's neck.
* Obviously a better instruction manual.
* The cup holder is floppy and kind of worthless.

He is old enough to be forward facing now and the seat provides a nice height for him to enjoy the outside world but also be snug within the car. We drive a Chevy Malibu. This seat is worth the extra $20 to $30 you might spend on a cheaper model.

Seat Type: front and rear facing, forward facing
Weight Range of Child: Safe up to 50 Lb
Harness Type: 5 point harness, shoulder straps
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:

The car seat should include a 5-point harness with shoulder straps.

Review: I bought this for a trip to California with my 2.5 year old daughter.  We have the diono radian carseat.  It fit perfectly using the superLATCH connectors.  We flew Southwest and I was able to wheel the cart + seat down the isle with no problems.  Unlatch the seat for setup in the airplane seat, and stow the cart in the overhead or under the seat relatively quickly.  I was traveling without another adult and this made it so much easier!  I could even wheel my daughter (38 pounds) through the airport in her carseat when we were in a hurry. I would recommend this to anyone traveling and planning on using a carseat on their flight. Even if I never fly with it again, this purchase was totally worth the money!

Summer or winter, our baby daughter is always sweating A LOT in this seat. Even after a 30 minute ride, her back is soaked and we have to change her top. On longer rides, she is just swimming in her own sweat. She does not have this problem with cheaper, portable seats. The material of the Britax Boulevard 70 -G3 is not breathable. We always keep the A/C on, do not use blankets when she is sleeping, but it does not help. We always have a spare top to change her in after she comes out of the seat. I imagine it is pretty uncomfortable for her.

Otherwise, it is a wide, comfortable seat and it is higher quality that similar seats from other manufacturers. Easy to buckle in and easy to instal.

Review: This car seat, especially considering the price, is a very good car seat.  I haven't had much difficulty with the harness, and my nine year old son can buckle and un-buckle it with minimal difficulty (he did pinch a finger the first time he tried it).  Other than that, I love that I can adjust the strap height with a button in the back, and not have to re-thread the belts every time the baby grows.  I also really like how comfortable it is to detach the seat from the base.  I'm not sure how else to word it, I just really like where my hands go and how easy it is to pull the handle to unlatch the seat/carrier as I'm taking it out of the car.

Review:
I have too many carseats due to people visiting and travelling. Our main seats used to be Britax Marathon, but they're so heavy and my chest protector thingy broke on one. I had a different Safety 1st for travelling and really liked it, so I got this one for my car while my daughter's dad was borrowing my Marathon (rear facing, so the plastic protector wasn't needed).

I really like this seat. The base is high enough that my daughter (now forward facing) can see out the windows from the center seat. It was a little more difficult to install- took my boyfriend kneeling on it to tighten it properly, but it's solid now. It's easy to adjust the back so the straps can grow with her, as those grey plastic twist things control the height. The removable cup holder is a godsend.

A BIG issue that pops up occasionally is that the straps can sometimes get stuck when trying to tighten. As in, they just don't tighten anymore and it's still loose on my daughter. It seems to happen more when the tightening strap is pulled up (which is how we tighten our other Safety 1st), but it's also just hard to tighten properly in general. I'm glad I didn't have this seat when my daughter was really small, as I can't imagine struggling to get it tight enough. In all though, I do like this seat, but eventually I'll get around to replacing it with the Britax (once I remember to call in for replacement parts). I really prefer the other Safety 1st we have more, but it won't last as long with the height.

Review: I bought two mifolds for an upcoming trip. I think I discovered a problem that those who only purchase one don't experience: the red side belt clips/slips are supposed to lock in place (expanded to rear size) when the child is belted, but one of our seats did not. Thus ensued major frustration from my 7yo and myself, trying to get the seatbelt out of the belt clip. As soon as I expanded it, we got the belt and my child out easily. I will be sending that one back, hopefully to get a non-defective one in return. This is a very easy quality-control test that clearly wasn't performed. Both belt side slips easily pushed back in without having to use the red tab, which my other apparent non-defective mifold required to get the belt slips in AND out.

It's even more vibrant in person than it is online. She's petite so we liked the added side protection. The only downfall, and perhaps I haven't adjusted it correctly, but she has a hard time with the straps on her shoulders. It all seems very cumbersome. At one point she was sitting so much forward she couldn't sit back. So we struggled to adjust it. Other than it being a little tricky with the straps, we love it!

The cup holder has been a great source on entertainment. He gets to use the cup holder like dad does. (and I don't have to reach back and get it when he's done!) We had the Roundabout before this and we will absolutly stay with Britax for all of our future car set needs.

Review:
This is the coolest car seat we have ever owned, and we have owned a lot. The only thing this doesn’t have is tech running through it. The instruction booklet is a must and thankfully, this car seat does have a tray located at the base to store the booklet! For when you need to make adjustments, remove the seat, etc. Also, this isn’t just for you, this is great for the friend, other parent, grandparent etc. that is helping you and may have no idea how this seat works.

I am sure some people are questioning my sanity about this trivial thing; but until you are sitting in a parking lot crying because you can’t figure out how to release the car seat from a locking base you will never understand my excitement of this feature. (Yes, that is a true story. )

The seat cover can be completely removed to wash. I have not had to remove my cover to wash it I have only used wash rags/ wipes to clean up spills. The side panels feel almost like canvas but with a coating on them. While the inside portion (where child sits) of the car seat is covered in a non-abrasive material that is a squishy (feel like memory foam) padding.

There are two removable head pillows, and a lumbar support / booster. I really wish my vehicle had this little thing. The belts expand with a simple push of the button located in the front of the seat, and then gently pull the harness straps. If you loosen too much pull the sing strap at the base to tighten. You can do this one handed.

There is a recline feature on the seat. To engage it once you pull a ‘trigger leaver’ at the bottom of the car seat, it is located in the front (where ankles would sit when taller) just pull forward and seat reclines. Again, this can be done one handed.

The car seat clamps to the vehicle metal U rings located in the back seat area, in addition it uses the seat belt to keep the seat stable & secure. When you first take the seat out of the box the clamps are already attached but tucked up under the outer sides for storage. At first, I thought these clamps were broken because when you press the release (red) button on them nothing happens; however when hooking them on you hold them like a Taser and push them onto the metal bars of the U rings until you hear them click. These will not disconnect unless you hold the red button, just like a seat belt, but you have to pull away from the ring while the button is engaged.

The cup holders lock into place, they are somewhat small but do hold a bottle securely unlike other holders. Larger sippy cups may not fit, I recommend checking yours first. You can remove them, to make the holder area bigger and for cleaning. You can run them through a dishwasher.

Overall this car seat looks and feels like it should be in a space shuttle, it’s very sturdy and not excessively heavy. It isn’t the removable kind you can use in a stroller but if you are looking to buy 1 seat that will grow with your child I believe this is it. This is also really good for grandparents to have so they can easily store it at home or leave it in a car and never have to worry if they have the right seat with them in any situation that may call for them to be the primary pick up.

Especially in the rear facing position when it has to recline in order to be installed properly. Review:
We bought this in Porter for my daughter when she was around 7 months and she is now 2.5 years. We've used it rear facing and forward facing. Overall, we like it.

Pros:

LATCH: easy latch, just click and then push the actual seat down instead of pulling. I still have my husband do a final push, but I can get it pretty tight with my body weight.

Comfy: lots of cushion and padding. Extra head and body inserts for little ones

Harness: no rethread, just pull both straps up or down to click into different positions

2 cupholders with bands= most cups fit

Belt tightening happens at the hips. I like this because I don't feel like I'm slicing her neck when I pull it tight. I can buckle everything, pull all slack to hips and then pull tight.

Seat is high up- I like this because my daughter gets carsick if she can't see, but she can't really climb into the seat by herself so it can be a con too

Covers and fully washable

Cons:

This seat is BIG. I measured around 21.5-22" at the cupholders.

Recline: I feel like they could have a few more reclines for comfort- you really only have one option per position.

Need extra positioner. I don't see anyway to install this seat at the proper level without pool noodles or a rolled up towel.

No level- there are 2 arrows that you're supposed to have level with the ground just by eyeballing.

Both cupholders are like half cupholders other a band which is good for diff sized cups, but she can't put snacks in or anything because it falls out.

Porter color doesn't have the advertised buckle pockets.

Most annoying feature- to take off the cover you have to UNSCREW both cupholders. My daughter got carsick the first few times she was forward facing and it was so much fun getting the cover off and on.

Review: I ordered the Pinnacle 90 to replace an older Roundabout which we loved but my child was starting to outgrow.  I was a bit hesitant to order the Pinnacle 90 simply because it looked really big and I was unsure if it would install properly in my tiny 2-door Honda Civic.  It installed just fine in my small car in a matter of minutes.  Installation was a breeze - I love the new clicktight system which lets you install the seat with the regular seatbelt quickly and securely - my car has the Latch system, but we are approaching the weight limit on that as well, so being able to install a seat well using the seatbelt is great.  I also love the adjustable harness height which allows you to adjust as your kid grows taller without having to take the whole seat apart.  Some previous reviews mentioned that the button for the strap adjustmen is too deep - personally I think this is great as it means my child cannot loosen the straps himself!  i have pretty small hands and was able to adjust the straps without any trouble.  All in all I am very pleased with the Pinnacle 90 - another great buy from Britax that gives me added peace of mind that my child is as safe as he can be.

Review:
We bought two of these to fit in the backseat of my 2012 Jetta Sportwagen. The biggest selling point for me was the 3 across feature. The seats are slim but my kiddos seem to have plenty of room. We can fit a backless booster with the two car seats and have no problems (none leaning on the other, and access to the belt buckles is fairly easy).

What surprised me is how much I love the seatbelt lock off. Installation was a breeze and I have never had a forward facing car seat so secure that it didn’t budge even a 1/4”!

The rear facing seat for my 1 year old was easy to install and I marveled at the extra leg room it gave her compared to her infant car seat. It has two rear facing recline positions and the level indicator is easy to read. It’s also is a lot slimmer depth wise so my husband has more leg room in the front.

The seats sit lower than our previous car seat so it’s easier to have my 4 year old climb in and out on his own. He loves the double cup holders too. Since it’s fall, I can’t speak about the mesh fabric being cooling yet, but I love the quality of the fabric.

The only complaint I have is minor. I don’t like the chest clip buckle as I can’t unclip it one handed. While it means my 4 year old won’t unclip it while driving, it also means I need to park my coffee cup on the roof of the car to get the kids out. Minor issue compared to the wonderful features of the car seat overall.

Great quality, very comfortable for our son, and very easy to install! It is heavy but I can easily switch it to other vehicles!

Review:
Pro:
It will clearly protect children from new born to grade school. as delivered, it comes out of the box and installs as a rear facing seat right into the car. The trickiest part was finding the car's child seat anchor points. Once you know where the anchors are it takes only seconds to put the seat in the car.

Con:
the instructions for changing the seat from rear facing to forward facing were very poor. Once you take most of the padding off it becomes fairly obvious how to configure the latches for the forward configuration. It took me a couple of minutes to figure out how to take the padding off.

Pro/Con;
The seat is big. this is a pro because it has lots of padding and will protect a child really well. it is a con because it does not fit very well in a small car (I have a ford focus) and the rear facing configuration completely blocks the back door window making it very hard to look right and to check the right blind spot. The forward facing configuration is better. Unless you are a small person, it will not fit behind the driver in either configuration.

Review: I originally bought this car seat as an extra for my mom's car because of the affordable price and reviews. I tried to keep my 4 year old in a 5 point harness as long as possible but finally he kept telling me his buckle was "hurting his penis". I knew at that time, it was time to upgrade! This booster looks great, feels super sturdy and is easy to assemble. The pieces basically just snap together. Not long after I bought this seat my son was in the back seat of my mom's mustang and was rear ended. The car was totaled, but luckily everyone was ok! I love this booster seat and I'd love to credit my son's safety to it. A key part of this I believe is the seat belt guides that properly put the seatbelt across the shoulder position. The seat wipes down easy and the cupholders are a plus. Today, I actually bought a second one of these boosters in red from Toys 'R' Us for $39.99 for our other vehicle. We also use a Graco Turbo Booster which was priced about $49.99 at Toys 'R' Us, but yet I still find myself buying a second Evenflo. As a matter of fact I have bought a total of 5 Evenflo carseats and I always tend to find myself favoring those. I originally started out with a Tribute when my son was little. In our primary vehicle we had a Britax Marathon because it had great safety reviews and I thought because it was more expensive, it must be better. That was the 5 point harness seat that was used from age 2 until 4. After only 2 years of use it seemed like it was falling apart. The interior styrofoam seemed to detach itself from the plastic and the cloth seat was forever coming undone. It also was so large, bulky and heavy it was a pain to take out and move if needed be. My younger son also had a newer Britax Boulevard which practically fell apart as well. We did take off the cloth cover to wash a few times, but with putting it back on a piece of the styrofoam interior ripped off and eventually the whole styrofoam liner started detaching itself again. I ended up throwing out the Boulevard, then giving my younger child the Marathon, and we finally got rid of that and he is in a Evenflo Maestro. I now have 2 Evenflo Maestro's! My point is do not think you are getting a lesser quality product because it is also one of the most affordable.

Review: I have bought and installed many car seats. My biggest issue has always been leveling and installing with latch. Nothing seems tight enough and I'm never 100% confident in the install. This seat is different. We bought the maroon color which looks great. The seat is heavy, but I don't have to move it so it isn't an issue. What I love is the bubble level on both sides so I know the angle is right. Also the dual cinch latch belt is awesome. Pull them in the right order and the seat was super secure without killing myself. Install took less than 10 minutes and part of that time was spent reading directions. I was nervous about buying an expensive seat, but it was worth every penny.

Review:
i have the Chicco convertible for my car but we needed another convertible so I wanted to try another since my son seems to be uncomfortable in Chicco. we went with britax. We installed using click tight and it is a nightmare to install properly. Once tightened in the click tight dial will not turn and you are unable to get seat out. You cannot loosen the strap to unlatch it either. I spent an hour, sweating, body shaking bc I could not get car seat adjusted due to faulty equipment. The Chicco is so easy to install properly it's a joke. I would never buy this seat again and I have no idea how I am going to take it out to make forward facing when the time comes.

Don't waste your time or mo eu when there are safe, user friendly alternatives!

Review:
I have had this car seat for nearly 3 years. I have really liked it with the exception of it being a little bulky to change from vehicle to vehicle.

Recently though, we have gotten a tear in the harness strap. I went Graco to buy a replacement strap, but none appeared, so I called. I was told that was NOT an option with this seat. Are you kidding?? A nearly 300 dollar car seat and it's not an option seems unacceptable to me. Especially since this is supposed to be a "forever" seat. I was upset on the phone and was told the most they could do would be a 40 dollar rebate on a new seat. Again still unacceptable. I'll be calling back. Anyway, I highly recommend checking into replacement parts before buying.

Review:
tldr: don't let your kids sit in them unless they're installed in the car.

We purchased 2 of these for our 5 and 6 year old and used them for 18 months. They were perfect; narrow enough that someone can fit in the middle seat, allow for them to buckle and unbuckle very easily, and meet all safety requirements. They were also very easy to adjust and clean.

We had them out of the car to clean the interior and the kids sat in them and apparently the backs do not support their weight outside of the car because the back reclined and broke. I understand this is not the intended use for them, but since they collapse forward, we thought there was surely a way to have them reset upright if collapsed back. We contacted Peg Perego and they were no help, so its unclear if they're fixable.

We're currently borrowing boosters from the grandparents and oh how I miss these. Kids cannot buckle themselves and seats just don't feel as sturdy. The price point on these is so high, but as we have a very tall now 7 year old, I feel we must re-purchase them because there is only one other high back option we can find that goes to 63" and it is extremely wide. After the terrible customer service, I just don't know if I can shell out another $600.

In addition, this is a great seat for regular use as well as it is lightweight and very comfortable.  We found this to be a great solution for an older child who was still too small/young for a seatbelt only but who didn't fit in a heavier, bulky booster seat. Overall, this is a great product for our family.

Review: We were involved in a highway accident. Something happened to the tire, I lost control of the car at 70 MPH, we did a 180 and slammed into the concrete barrier (on the rear side, where my kids were). I have three kids, my two daughters were on the side that got hit. My 22 month old daughter is in this carseat, and my 3-year-old in the older model boulevard. They walked away without a scratch. My almost two-year-old slept through the whole thing! She only woke up because my 3-year-old was crying (because she was scared, not hurt). My sister and I were in the front seat and we are okay, but very sore, whip lash, etc. I'm amazed that my children aren't even talking about the accident, and they aren't even the slightest bit sore, even though they were a lot closer to the place of impact! My husband and I don't have much money, but car seats were something that we weren't going to skimp on. Now I am so thankful that we did. We will definitely stick with Britax forever.

Review:
I got this seat because it has the highest height requirement of any five point seat (at least from what I could find in fall of 2013). My tall, average weight, daughter LOVES it. We also have Radian XTSLs and we were looking for a seat for our second car for my wiggly almost 7 year old. Although she is both tall and heavy enough to just use a booster, I don't know that she would always sit propperly, so I needed a seat that would keep her in a 5point for another couple years. Problem solved. The Pinnacle is tall, comfy, and feels more like a big kids seat to her.

Added bonus- we were shipped a seat that had been manufactured within 2 months of us receiving the seat, allowing us to use it for its full life and to hand it down to our other kids. We are very very happy with it.

Review:
Jeep Wrangler 4 door owners beware. We love Britax car seats. Have had them for our older 2 children. With upcoming birth of our third we again decided to go with Britax. Me being the prepared person figured we should install car seat before baby arrival. Good thing we tried. If you own a Jeep Wrangler 4 door (ours is a 2015) you need to note this is NOT the infant car seat for you. The instructions clearly state the base of the car seat should not overhang the edge of the seat by more than 3 inches. Well - a jeep car seat is not as deep as most so the overhang is at least 5-6 inches. So sad we cannot use. We did try a Chicco Key Fit 30 - (Babies R Us will allow you to take the seats out of the store to try in your vehicle). That one will work as base is quite a few inches shorter than that of Britax and has an excellent safety rating and we can still fit the infant car seat, a Radian RXT in the middle and a Gracco backless booster behind driver safely.

Just hope to save someone the hassle of buying and having to return like we did as it was not something we would even think of until you actually read instructions.

Installation Type: base of the car seat should not overhang the edge of the seat
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:

The base of the car seat should not extend beyond the edge of the vehicle seat.

Review:
Our 28-inch six-month old grew out of his infant seat, so we needed to buy a larger car seat. We purchased this car seat based on the glowing reviews. I wish I would have also looked at reviews from other websites. It is a great seat (installation was simple, it looks comfy and he can look out the window), except for the buckle between his legs is WAY TOO SHORT. There is no way to lengthen it and he is sitting almost right on top of it when I put him in the seat. Each time I buckle him in I have to make a concerted effort to avoid pinching his tights (which aren't even very chubby).

We ordered the Boulevard and the strap between the legs is a couple of inches longer and works much better.

Review:
listen. we bought these for both of our children due to their roll-over and side impact testing.
we were recently in an accident where my car was in neutral and was rear ended by another car at 40 mph and then subsequently pushed into the car i front of me.
my daughter was 100% unfazed and looked up o. e we came to a stop and said “what was that” (2yrs),
my son was asleep at the time so he was less happy but he only received one minor bruise from the accident and immediately stopped crying once removed from the car (1 yr)
i truly believe the car i was in coupled with such nice car seats saved my family from potential major injuries or death.
if they weren’t in the accident i would of even kept the seats the only damage they sustained was that one lost a cup holder.

Review:
Purchased it as we were going on vacation and needed something light and easy to set.
PROS:
- Easy to carry around, not only because it’s light but due to the backpack bag it comes with.
- It has 2 different ways you can select from to set up in the car. Either the anchor belts on the sides or by putting a seat belt behind it. After doing some research I found that you have to pick one of the two securing methods, it’s not recommend to place both at the same time unless you car manual deems it necessary. Reason being that certain pressure points were tested on each method and those can be off if you secure the seat using both methods.
- Easy and fast to set up in car
CONS:
- The belt that goes between the child’s legs to click onto the shoulder belts is very short. I’m not sure if there’s a certain extender they sell after realizing they might have miscalculated when creating it but I’ve read many parents have complained about the exact thing.
- There’s no place for a child to put their head on the sides if they’re sleeping.
- Too Expensive for a seat your child won’t be able to comfortably use on a day to day
- The belts used to tight the anchors of the car seat to the car as extremely difficult to tighten. We tried tightening it while pushing down the side button and it was very difficult we also tried without pressing the side button and it was equally as difficult.

Overall we like the seat for travel because of how light it is, but I wish it was more practical so I could continue using it as my everyday car seat. Unfortunately, because of the short belt between the child’s legs this isn’t a car seat I could realistically use with my child for long as he’d be too uncomfortable.

Review:
I will begin by stating that I’m a bit of a car seat safety fanatic. These seats can literally mean the difference between life and death (or serious injury) for our little ones, so I am unwilling to compromise on safety.

With that being said, these are my thoughts...

-Relatively easy to install, compared to others
-Plenty of cushioning for the child, which likely adds comfort for many (although I do not value comfort over safety)
-Does not allow extended rear-facing for as long as some other models (rear-facing is the safest way for a while to ride)
-A little difficulty getting this seat to fit snugly in the car, without moving more than an inch when shaken
-I guess the cup holders are bonuses for some buyers but are not very important to me (and keep in mind that anything in them can become a projectile in case of accident)
-Materials seems easy to wipe clean

All in all, I think this is an okay car seat. There are others on the market, at a similar price point, with higher safety ratings.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear-facing
Installation Type: Relatively easy to install
Material: Materials seems easy to wipe clean
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The seat should be rear-facing. Installation should be relatively easy. The materials should be easy to wipe clean.

Review: I really wanted to like the two identical Diono car seats that we purchased for out twins, but were sadly disappointed when the kids began to grow and we needed to adjust the head rest height. Put simply, the headrest on both car seats refuses to stay in place once raised. On numerous occasions I was forced to stop the car, raise the headrest only to have it fall back down within 10-15 minutes. I tried contacting Diono and they suggested that I uninstall the seats (fun!) and try tightening the head rest bolts located on the back. After tearing both seats out, re-tightening the bolts, the headrests immediately failed to maintain the desired position for each of our kids. When I contacted Diono again they said they would send out some sort of "remedy plate" which would require additional time to install with no guarantee of a permanent fix. At that point I declined the offer and threw both seats in the trash. Happy to say our Graco replacements are working great, have a headrest that easily locks and are a fraction of the price of the Diono model. Hope this review will be helpful to others

Review:
THIS WAS WORTH THE MONEY and less expensive than a dedicated car seat carrier and we didn't take a stroller.

We did not put our 2 yo in this while pulling. My husband used his Mission Critical carrier so that we didn't have to take Mini-Dragon in and out of the seat. This worked out b/c while I thought my bag was carry on size, the Southwest agent told me otherwise so we wound up checking our bag and the seat.
On the way from HOU (Hobby, Houston, TX) to CMH (Columbus, OH) the bag we strapped the carseat to was empty. My older son and I were able to squish the suitcase enough to TIGHTLY strap on the carseat.
Using the directions on the box it was super easy to put on and take off the carseat from the strap/around the suitcase.
On the reverse route we struggled to get the seat on since my In-Laws sent us home with a ton of gifts (hence the empty suitcase) and the bag was fluffy fat. I wound up swearing a few times and allowed the seat to be tipped slightly sideways since my husband again was carrying the little guy. THIS is where I wish we'd had the carabiner clips other reviewers mentioned. Even if you think you might not use them, on the off chance you do need them, keep them with the strap.
This product is ingenious and really helped us take along our own carseat and not play roulette with the rental system.

To store it, I just stuffed the strap into my carryon or the diaper bag.

TL; DR: Buy it, get some carabiners and possibly a carseat cover if you decide to check the seat. Works with carseat tightening strap completely loosened.

Review:
I love this carseat so much, I'm going to purchase another one for our other car! I was having a hard time finding a carseat that was high-weight on the 5-point harness that didn't cost a ton of $$. My kid is a car sleeper, so good head support was a must (this is an issue with my other carseat now).

It has great head support for when he falls asleep, nice deep, wide cupholder, and is the most secure fit I've gotten in any of my carseats so far! My 30-month, 30-pound son is very comfy, and it's super easy to adjust around his clothing, etc. NOTE: I don't recommend putting it together in a parking lot at 11PM in winter, as it takes some time to assemble and is hard to do with cold fingers :)

UPDATE 9/24/10: I have to knock this down a star now that my kid has grown some more. We had to remove him from the 5-point harness just before his 5th birthday, even though he's only about 44lbs. The crotch strap on this is TOO CLOSE to the back of the seat. So when we buckle him in 5-point, it smushes his 'stuff' and makes him uncomfortable for the whole ride. It became so much of an issue that we had to discontinue use of the harness and go to the belt. The whole reason I got this was for the high-weight limit on the 5-pt. In addition, it's VERY hard to clean. Easy enough to get the pads off and wash, etc, but when you disassemble it there are a ton of little crevices that are filled with nasty stuff (cracker crumbs, raisins, you name it) that is SO hard to get out! It's at 4 stars (down from 5) due mainly to the crotch strap issue, though...but still very comfy and easy to buckle into.

Review:
We switched from the Graco car seat and immediately noticed a huge difference. This seat has much more cushioning and looks like it's much more comfortable for the baby. In addition to the extra built in cushioning, there's an extra cushion for around the rear and legs (removable for when baby's bigger), a cushion for the crotch area where the buckle is, and cushions for the harness straps. This seat also feels very sturdy with the steel support beams. The safety rating is the primary reason we bought this seat. We love the pattern, it's very gender neutral.

The baby seems to be comfortable in the chair. He didn't sleep in it in the beginning but that's probably because it was new. My only real complaint with it is that since we still have it rear-facing and my baby is very long/tall for his age, his legs hit the back of the car seat and he has to bend his knees or spread his legs apart to fit in it. We are hoping to be able to turn him around soon.

As I still have my 3 year old rear facing, I first tried to install two of them rear facing, on behind the passenger seat and the other in the middle with the hopes of putting an infant seat behind the driver side. I was already discouraged as the two of these installed next to each other was already not fitting properly. One was already on a lean that is indicative of improper installation.  But I still pressed on and tried to install the infant seat on the other end and there was NO WAY that was fitting. So then I tried an infant seat on either side with this seat in the middle both rear facing and even forward facing. Nope. Does not work, no matter the configuration. I am very disappointed.

Review:
Against my gut, I went ahead and got this to try out for my niece and it just doesn't work as a rear facing car seat. It's super slim, so it almost fits 3 across, but even in the van I would struggle to go three. It has two and would be a tight fit on three for me. The lack of a base just caused a headache. I have a newer 2019 Chevy Equinox, as well as a 2013 minivan and it is not working in either vehicle. I thought that I'd give it a go in my Dad's 05 Silverado and see if it was just something with the way the seats were in my car, versus perhaps and older vehicle and it still didn't work correctly.

I followed all of the instructions, watched videos, and even resorted to taking it to the fire house for a check. The seat just does not want to stay on the level line. My niece is only 23 lbs, well within the range of the 5-40 lbs recommended for the rear facing option. I worked with the firehouse to get it level and then put her in it. I did a few test laps out back and sure enough, after a few bumps and driving around the building, when I'd get out the level line would be off. It has a suggestion in the booklet about using a towel or rolled up blanket, but that still didn't fix the issue.

The seat is cute, and it does work when flipped around, though. I tested it out forward facing and it stays where it should and is leveled out. It's kind of frustrating after going through all the steps. What I ultimately decided to do was take my nephews EvenFlow convertible seat and flip it to rear facing for my niece and then flipped this one forward for my nephew. He doesn't seem to mind the Miney seat and once they're both big enough, I can flip the seats back around and use this for my nieces seat. It's just been a process and I cannot recommend this in good conscience as a rear facing seat. It was a hassle. I hope I explained it well enough and that someone finds this helpful.

To it's positive, the clips on this are easy to adjust. The design is great. It is cushioned and well padded on the sides. The dual cup holders are awesome for taking sippy cups and drinks along without spills. I also like that the back piece can come out and I can wash it or wet cloth wash it and it seems to dry quickly. I just can't use this rear facing. The men at the firehouse suggested that I actually flip the other seat, so that's what we're doing. The front facing option has been a non-issue thus far.

Review:
Our 18 month old had out-grown her rear-facing Graco car-seat with stroller. We saw other Triumph 65 models at various local stores but the price on here was much better. This is a huge upgrade from her old seat in comfort and sizing. We rally have only three minor complaints:

1. The cup holder is pathetic. We didn't even bother attaching it.
2. It was a little difficult to get tightened down to the van seat when rear facing. I ended up using both the anchor clips AND the seatbelt to tighten it down.
3. The strap loosen/tighten mechanism some times jams and makes it a little difficult to loosen the straps to get the child out.

Otherwise, we are very happy with the purchase. From placing our child in comparible seats in-stores this one seemed to be the most comfortable one that actually had a legitimate (although not extremely easy to use) recline feature. Some of the others say they recline, but the degree of recline is so laughable on most of the other models that I would be ashamed to even list it in the product features.

Review:
I havent used this car seat yet so will update accordingly at a later date. However, out of the box, I'm thoroughly impressed.

Purchased for my 6th baby. So I'm no stranger to carseats and features. This one had every feature important to me.

The fabric is great. T shirt type material, soft. Lots of padding. Which was important to me as we are very rural and baby needs to be in the seat for extended periods of time. I had issues in the past with my babies fussing in other seats because they were hard and uncomfortable. So I appreciate the extra comfort. With that, I anticipate this seat to hold heat tho.

One handed handle operation. This is a great feature. All too many times, mamas are holding a sleeping baby and trying to transfer to a car seat, only to find the handle forward as we juggle holding baby and trying to get a handle back with 2 hands. The one handed operation is a timesaver. I've played with it enough that I dont foresee a problem accidently moving the handle.

Adjustable crotch snap. This feature is wonderful for a growing baby. Too many carseats have the buckle set in one place and lil babies are slouching and bigger babies are pinched. So to be able to move closer/further away with growth is a great security and comfort factor.

No puzzle lock. OMG...who's idea was that anyway? I detest puzzle locks. This one buckles in, straight, from each side without having to twist and turn the 2 buckles together before inserting into the latch.

The headrest and buckles seem to be easy to move. Just a button to press and pull to adjust. I've had too many carseats that straps had to literally be removed and rethreaded. It's a pain. I already appreciate the ease of adjustments with this one. Same with the harness. A button to press to loosen and tighten when putting baby in and removing.

The boot. I live in cold weather. The boot is a great extra feature. My complaint on this one...it doesnt securely attach. Merely clips on. I can already forsee it sliding. So we will see. I may make some amendments to it to attach it more securely.

The canopy is the best. You can literally pull it down completely to the boot. No more sunshine beaming in babys face. There is a mesh window towars the back for airflow and to let you peek in.

The base seems simple and solid to install. It also includes a feature to lock a seatbelt into place that would otherwise slide, requiring an additional metal lock, in the past, to be placed on seatbelts to circumvent. Yes, latch is included as well.

Review:
We liked this car seat, but ultimately it didn't end up dethroning our favorite.

There's a lot to like about this seat. It's well made, the baby is comfortable in it, and it grows well with your child. Material and workmanship both seem very nice and honestly we wouldn't be concerned about carrying our daughter around in it now that she's a year and a half old.

We weren't thrilled with other aspects of the seat. We use the LATCH system, and was disappointed that this uses the old clipping mechanism instead of the newer quick release straps. If you're moving this between cars a lot, this will definitely slow you down. We also felt like the seat was a bit TOO spacious for a very young infant. There wasn't nearly as much lateral (side to side) support with this seat as there was with our chosen seat. Our daughter was born under 5 pounds, and even when she was 5 pounds, I wouldn't trust putting her into this seat until she got over 12 pounds or more. Just feels like there's too much wiggle room - even using the inserts.

We also felt like the cupholders were an odd choice. They aren't terribly deep and the elastic, while being a clever idea, just didn't work as well as a good, deep cupholder.

As far as the comfort goes, our girl seemed to like it, but we didn't really notice any difference in the "comfort mesh" than with any other seat we've tried. Their back is going to get sweaty, period. (At least if you live in the western states.)

Despite our concerns, it IS a good, well built seat. We just don't think it quite justifies a full 5 stars as there were just one too many things we weren't thrilled about. Still, as one of the more budget-friendly seats, it's good for what it is and we can recommend it - but only if your child is a little older.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: LATCH system, old clipping mechanism instead of newer quick release straps  
Weight Range of Child: under 5 pounds, over 12 pounds  
Material: comfort mesh
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:
The car seat should be easy to install using a LATCH system.  
The car seat should be suitable for children under 5 pounds.  
The car seat should be suitable for children over 12 pounds.  
The car seat should have comfortable, breathable material.  
An older clipping mechanism for installation is acceptable.  
The absence of newer quick-release straps is acceptable.

Review:
We needed an additional car seat for our 3-year-old and chose this as it will convert to a booster and take him to 100 lbs. I took a chance on this as it gets overall good reviews and is cheaper than many others, but after getting it myself I have to concur with some of the common complaints in the negative reviews:

--The main issue is that we cannot get it tight enough no matter what we do. The top leans to one side even after being straightened up, and there's no way to meet the "it shouldn't move more than one inch back and forth" standard on the bottom. It's just too loose to be safe. We're using the seatbelt secure method (not the latch) given my son's weight. We also used the tether.
--The crotch strap falls down into the seat and I have to dig it out from under him almost every time I put him in the seat.
--The cup holders on both sides are more a pain than a convenience. It makes it even harder to get him in the seat, having to almost drag him over the cup holders--and that's with nothing in them!

He says it's comfortable, but it just doesn't seem secure enough.

A couple of things that take off a star:

Additionally, my daughter is small for her age at over two years old so I still have her rear facing. This unit is not adjustable so sometimes she seems a little cramped, especially for long trips. Once we turn her forward facing it won't be a problem, but she does seem to be a little uncomfortable at times.

Other than that, it's a good size and is a safe unit, just a few things to consider.

Review: We purchased the Evenflo Stratos for a spare car seat. I have two Graco Extend2Fits for my 27 month old son(one in each parent's car). I wished I had gotten another one of those rather than this seat for a few reasons. This seat is difficult for me to install. I can't seem to get it tight enough with LATCH, but got a better and more secure install using the seat belt. This seat came with LATCH connector "guides" to help find the LATCH hooks. It was horrible trying to install this seat without those. It was so frustrating! While the seat isn't very plush, my child seemed to be comfortable and had enough leg room. He is pretty petite anyway(25lbs and 33in tall). This seat isn't very compact front to back and only offers two recline settings, but still fit well in my 2015 Ford Fusion SE. I love the fact that this seat will still last my son awhile(probably until he is at least five or six years old). It can fit children from 5-40lbs and 19-40in rear facing and goes up to 65lbs and 54in forward facing. The cup holders are ok, my son puts snacks in them because his sippy cups do not fit in them at all(we use Gerber Essentials cups). I like the seat overall, I feel my child is safe in this seat, but I just love my Graco seats and wished I had spent the extra money.

Review:
**Update** After 2 years of ownership and daily use, the strap to tighten the harness is frayed and hard to use. Graco says it cannot be replaced, and they won’t replace the seat. Now we’re stuck with it or face spending $$$ to replace it ourselves.**

We own two of these and we find it hard to tighten the harness on both, still, after months of use. We have just gotten used to struggling with it a little every time. When we first got the seats, I had a lot of trouble unbuckling the chest buckle, but either I have learned how to do it or the buckle has relaxed a little, because I only struggled with that for about a week. Recently we had to wash the cover on one of our seats, and we were able to put it back together with fairly little difficulty. The size of this seat makes it hard for tall people to ride in the passenger seat in front of it in one of our cars (2009 Subaru Forester), but it's not too bad. Hopefully our daughter can forward face before we need to extend the head rest further. We started using this seat when our daughter was about 11 months old and had outgrown her bucket seat by height. She had no problem with the transition to this seat. She seems comfortable on trips up to 2 hours (we haven't gone further). Now that it's summer I can say that it seems like the purple color fabric doesn't heat up very much.

Review:
I travel a lot with my kids. My son is 2 yo. He sits up almost at a 90 degree angle. When he falls asleep, his head falls forward (he hates the pillow helpers). I think this would be a problem with all the same types. I tried putting him in it at 14 months. He would cry when he started to fall asleep. He hated sitting up right. It says it has a reclining position....its only moves an inch.

It feels very heavy and safe. It's easy to install.

I had no problems ordering mine from Amazon. It does ship in its box.

I do like this car seat but I wish my son was 3 or older.

Review:
I've been using this for years with my first born and now my 2nd child. We travel alot because my parents lives across country. This made our life so much easier to travel with kids. We place our Britax seat and securely lock it on there and we sat our little in her carseat & BUCKLED her up and roll her through the terminal. No need to carry our child through the airport and No strollers needed. The best part is the wheels rolls (glides) so smoothly over everything. Once we get to the aircraft all we had to do was unlock the seat and fold it up. Its nice and light to store right in the over head bin. I also paid for my child’s seat so i would bring her seat on board to sit her in it. I used this cart up until she was 4yrs old with her car seat. Better than checking in her car seat and they toss it around like it’s nothing. When we get to the aircraft I check her seat at the craft’s door & just wait for it right after we get off the plane, i’ll Put the seat back onto the cart and wheel her thru the airport without any delays of having to maneuver thru the crowds with carry ons & helping a little human that takes 2 steps vs your 10
Steps.
I definitely recommend this cart it’s a life savor for any parents traveling with toddlers. I’ve used this for my first child and 2nd and it has held up! 2nd child i used it with the cosco seat and it works just fine.

Review:
Used this in the rear facing position only. Bought from Target.

Likes:
1. Cushioning/styling is very nice.

Dislikes:
1. The belts do not slide very well through the slide points. This includes the cinch to take slack out of/put slack in the harness and ESPECIALLY the latch system whether tightening or loosening. These should work with minimal resistance, not be near impossible to pull (it’s like the release button didn’t work at all).
2. The way the seat is balanced in the rear facing direction. The latch system Doesn’t seem to be properly positioned, which causes the seat to not be stable enough to stay in one place. Even with both the latch system and the shoulder belt threaded through there, the bottom rear of the seat (car forward) is rounded and will fall with weight added to the seat back. If you couple this with number one, 2 very seemingly unsafe things will happen (look at the picture): the seat will lay down, as the bottom of the seat starts to ride up the car seat back, and the seat will sway from side to side. I tried sitting all 260 lbs of me onto the car seat to get it to go down as far as possible, then tried securing the latch belt as best I could and the thing lasted 2 days in this position and by the third day started to fall/slide.
3. The seat is difficult to adjust. You have to pull out the seat bottom (booster) completely and make your adjustments, then thread both the latch system AND harness back into the seat bottom, which, for me, a 21 year technician took three hands to do well. A few times I’d get 3/4 belts seated properly, only to have the booster not seat properly back into the seat back, or one got caught in a pinch point and I had to do the thing all over again.
4. The price for what it is. Look, it’s a lot of molded plastic and well padded cushions and at first glance it looks like it should be worth what they’re asking, but when you take into account all the problems I had with it, it didn’t do near as well as the $219 Graco I exchanged it for. Night and day difference. Granted, the Graco doesn’t “look” as nice as this one, but the user friendliness of the evenflo is atrocious.

With all the other positive reviews I wonder if I got a bad apple. I wonder if the system that tightened up the belts needed some lubrication or something, but the design flaws are there molded right into the plastic. I’m happy I got my money back and that the Graco was so much better. I’m not being paid by any company, I just hope some guy doesn’t make the same mistake I did. Buyer beware.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Latch
Harness Type: Harness
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:
The car seat should be rear facing.
The car seat should be installed using the Latch system.
The car seat should have a harness.

Review:

It is soooo hard to get out of the base. I have to wiggle it ALOT to get it out and with a sleeping baby - not a good idea. My husband can barely do it. It is also too heavy (even though all the reviews say it isn't). We also looked for 2 months for a stroller to use it with and couldn't find one to work. It does not have the traditional latch on the bottom to fit into a universal stroller frame or even on the grocery cart. Combi does make a stroller to use with it, but not in the Mandrin color option. Sigh... We have sadly sent it back and purchased another option and I am sad.

Things I do love are the handle, the foot safety bar and the material, but that is all.

Review: I've purchased and returned a dozen boosters and most are so beyond frustrating that I take months off in between shopping.  This one finally, finally is smart.  It's totally adjustable and will fit any kid.  Our daughter is 6.  The back of it is aluminum, not cheap plastic, so it is actually sturdy.  The rigid latch will secure it to your car, rock solid, even preventing side to side wiggle.  And it's narrow, so you can actually get to the seat belt latch.  The upper part where the belt goes through is also the best design so far, so the belt can't come out  and believe it or not, the "recline" feature actually works.  And works well.  This is quality Italian engineering and you get what you pay for.  Ive confirmed to fit across several BMWs (X3, 5 serie, M3) which are notoriously challenging with latch and rear space, so this should work in any car.  And yes, it's price is outrageous.  Double or triple what the others cost.  It's also better than the cheaper one from the same company because of the aluminum back and adjustability.  So if you're like me and ready to give up shopping for these things, know that this one is finally smart.

Review:
I was a car seat tech for many years and always love getting to review new car seats. Some of my reviews have not been real popular because I didn't rant and rave about how wonderful the seat was! I'm happy to say, I was very pleased with this seat. It is very user friendly and installs well.

Pros:
- No need to re-thread the harness when adjusting the height. Over the years, I saw a lot of mis-threading mistakes made by parents, so this is a very nice feature.
- Separate LATCH attachments for rear and forward facing. Again, a common mistake is using the rear facing belt bath for forward facing installs. Having separate LATCH connectors should reduce this. I hope.
- Easy install forward and rear facing. Obviously, I can't try the seat in every vehicle, but in the two I did try, the seat installed tight with very little effort. The rear facing recline was perfect without any rolled towels or pool noodles as well.
- The adjuster pulled very smooth and I didn't have any issues with the harness wanting to fold over in the buckle.
- The instructions were very clear.
- Nice, deep sides and good side impact protection. Yes, I realize we don't test for this in the US, but deep side wings are always a pro.
- The infant insert is nice. Unfortunately, my baby is 6 months old so I really can't test out how well the seat fits a small newborn.
- High rear facing weight limit is great, but not real unique in this day and age.

Cons:
The only real con I saw was that the fabric was kind of slick and itchy. It's also booooring, but these things are not big cons at all. They are more like personal likes/dislikes and don't impact the safety of the seat at all.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible
Weight Range of Child: High rear facing weight limit
Installation Type: LATCH, Separate LATCH attachments for rear and forward facing
Harness Type: No need to re-thread the harness when adjusting the height, The adjuster pulled very smooth, I didn't have any issues with the harness wanting to fold over in the buckle
Material: The fabric was kind of slick and itchy
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The child car seat should be suitable for both rear-facing and forward-facing use, including convertible options. It should accommodate a high rear-facing weight limit. Adjusting the harness height should not require re-threading, and the harness adjuster should operate smoothly without issues like folding over in the buckle. Review:
This car seat has been a great choice! My husband and I are both over 6 feet tall and our child is well on his way to being tall as well. At 4 months old, he grew out of our infant carrier and we needed a larger seat but still keep him rear facing. This was a great, inexpensive (comparatively) option that we feel confident with to keep our child safe.
We have a Toyota Camry and because we’re both so tall, our seats are pushed all the way back. This car seat almost fit behind the passenger seat. If we moved the seat up an inch or so, it would fit easily behind the passenger. Because we do a lot of traveling and like to keep the seat all the way back, we did move the car seat to the middle so it wasn’t touching the seat in front and there’s plenty of room. Our son is 28” and so far we haven’t had to use the leg room extender, but we love that it has that option!
Using the latch system, the seat is super easy to install! Using the seat belt method, it was definitely a little trickier, but it wasn’t impossible.
The only downside is that because of the cupholders, while rear facing, it is a little wide. A booster seat may fit next to it, but definitely not another car seat. We have it in the middle of the car and it’s manageable for two slim adults to sit on either side, but it’s definitely a tight squeeze in a sedan. We also used it in a larger pickup and we were able to fit the seat and two adults comfortably.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing
Weight Range of Child: 4 months old
Installation Type: latch system, seat belt method
Harness Type: leg room extender
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The car seat should be rear facing to accommodate a child around 4 months old. It should be installable using either the latch system or the seat belt method. The harness should provide extended leg room.

Review:
We needed a narrow booster seat to fit three across in our car. We use this for our eldest, who at 10 is about to graduate from boosters altogether. He began using it at about age 7. We don't need height from a booster for him, just the shoulder belt positioner. The seat belts in our backseat are really high, so he still needs that feature for now. I recommend this seat for older, bigger, mature kids who don't need seat height or a reminder to sit right, just a better fit to the lap and/or shoulder seat belts. It's also great for difficult three-across installations, travel, and carpools.

I think they may have fixed this since we bought ours, but we do find the lap belt guides tricky to thread. It took awhile before my son could do that part himself.

I also find the expiration date of four years to be on the low end for car seats. Then again, for the price, you get a lot of use out of it.

It's a very handy seat for travel, as we've recently found. You deflate it and toss it into whatever bag is handy — easy peasy. Blow it back up at your destination, and you're good to go. The only downside is how mucky the back of a seat gets in the car, and then you have to put your mouth on it, ha ha. This seat would also work well for carpool kids and ride-share travel and friends visiting and the like, assuming the users fit the size requirements. (With the 40-pound minimum, my skinny middle child at nearly 7 can still not use this seat.)

Comfort-wise, my son complained at the downgrade in comfort level from his previous Britax front-facing car seat. However, he stopped complaining after a few days, and he's been fine with the BubbleBum ever since. It doesn't have bells and whistles, such as arm rests or cupholders, which is what helps keep it narrow and easy to fit into a small space. My son's on the larger end of the percentile calculators for height and weight, and he does fine with it. I think his thighs spill over the sides a bit, but he doesn't seem to mind that. It's basically like sitting on a regular seat in the car with a tiny bit of air cushion. So it's not plush, but they'll be fine once they get used to it. My son's not prone to peer pressure around this issue, but I'll point out that it's a nice option for older kids who don't want an obvious booster but still need that belt positioning help.

All in all, the BubbleBum has worked nicely for us, and we'd get another one if our younger kid ever gets above 40 pounds!

Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The child car seat must be a booster seat suitable for children weighing at least 40 pounds. It must be installable using seat belts with lap belt guides. It must provide positioning help for the shoulder belt. It must include air cushion material.

Review:
This booster seat is awesome. It didn’t think much of the latch, but in hindsight, I am so glad I got this. It makes all the difference for my son when he gets in. He reaches in and pulls himself up with the arms and there is no movement. It took a couple tries to get the latch down tight, but since then it hasn’t moved. The little hiding spot draw is great, but my son sometimes has issues opening. It is more user error than chair error.

The booster seat itself is light and easily fit in the seat for a BMW X3. No issues with width. The height is right up to the headrest, so I just raised the headrest one notch.

Review: We have an almost five year old purple Radian RXT and recently were rear-ended by an elderly gentleman when his foot slipped on the gas pedal and he accelerated quickly into the back of my Honda Odyssey. We were at a complete stop when the impact happened so we all snapped forward quite violently. I sustained whiplash and hyper-extension injuries to my neck and Trapezius muscles whereas my 5-year-old daughter in the Radian was not hurt at all. I attribute this to her Diono car seat considering the stark contrast between my injuries and her sustaining absolutely none. We will be replacing the car seat and will buy another Diono as we know first hand that they do their job.

Review: This is my second Britax car seat, the other is the infant B-safe car seat, which I love, but my large baby grew out of it rather fast. I am quickly realizing how wonderful Britax car seats are. This is my second baby and I've probably bought 5 or 6 car seats already! I am now realizing why I didn't like any of those. Two BIG reasons: Ease of use and COMFORT. My 2.5 year old is in a Graco Nautilus 3 in 1 which I thought was PERFECT until I bought this convertible Britax for my infant. The Marathon is sooooo cushy and comfy for baby. I even took out the insert because my baby didn't need it and it didn't take away from the comfort at all! I just love how padded it is! Now when I put my toddler in his seat, I realize how HARD his seat it and REALLY lacks in padding. Seems like a minor thing but we take many road trips and I can only imagine how that must feel on his legs and bum after awhile. The Marathon also feels so solid and safe and I LOVE not digging the crotch buckle out from under them for once. I am just so in love with the safety, comfort, and user friendly features (i.e. the buckle and harness!)of Britax car seats! We are definitely Britax fans now! I am now seriously considering the Britax Frontier for my 2.5 year old for our primary car and moving the Graco Nautilus to my husbands car.

I feel like this one is just as secure as our more expensive Chicco and even purchased it a second time for my father's vehicle.

The latch design allows us to feel like the seat is secured inplace as opposed to to others that just sit in the seat freely. The latch brackets are easy to install as well.

Review:
I hated this seat and will 100% not use it for my next child. As the reviews state it is very fancy looking which is what drew us to it but the MOST important thing is 1- your baby's comfort and 2- functionality. This seat is very tight and deep so it is not comfortable for the baby once they grow beyond a newborn size and we ended up buying a new seat when he was 6 months because both our son and my husband and I hated this seat. From a functionality standpoint, because of the size of the seat it was extremely hard to put even a very tiny baby in and out of the seat which was brutal for me. Everything was so difficult to attach and click in

Maxi Cosi also sells an adaptor kit to attach this seat to an uppa baby stroller. When you attach it to the stroller the seat leans forward so the babys head flops forward and given newborns sleep all the time this made the attachment to that stroller unusable.

I wouldn't recommend this car seat to anyone. Don't be fooled by the good looks, you and your baby will hate it!

Review: We looked at a LOT of convertible carseats, and this is the best we found.  We can still have our son rear-facing, even though he is 19 months old (24 lbs, almost 33 inches long), and we will be able to continue having him rear-facing way past his 2nd birthday, which is very much safer than forward-facing for little ones.  It was also one of the only ones that made it easy to put our son in and out of, since some were SO large that they left no room for getting him in and out of our Chevy Malibu.  Our son is very comfortable in it and he LOVES being able (finally!) to see out of the car.  It is a very nice-looking carseat too, and easy to wipe clean.  It is also just very well-made, unlike many others, which simply feel and look cheap.  We had bought a cheap convertible carseat (Cosco brand) for a plane trip over the summer, and it is already tearing a little at the seams after a total of about a week of use.  Yes, this Peg Perego carseat  is more expensive than many carseats out there, but why do you want a cheap and poorly-made carseat to protect your most precious possession in the world?  If you paid more for your cell phone than for your carseat, you may want to rethink your priorities.  We highly recommend it for anyone interested in the best for their child.

Pretty disappointed in that for the price. It was difficult to fit my chunky newborn in at first because the straps wouldn’t loosen enough. To overcome that I had to unclip the portion of the strap used to tighten from under the front of the seat.

PROS: As far as everything else, it is very easy to install, my baby seems to like it, and the headrest is easy to adjust. Easy to move in and out of stroller. Baby had a blowout in the seat and it was not overly difficult to remove and clean the fabric. There were also no stains even with the light color.

In general I am happy with this car seat and would recommend it but I wish a few things would change.

Review:
I'm sure the car seat itself is okay, but check to make sure that the item you receive is brand new. The one we just received was clearly not brand new as advertised. You could tell that someone had used it in their vehicle as there were indentations in the fabric and scuffs on the bottom. We will be returning it and purchasing the same one from Target or BabiesRUS.

Update: We ordered the same car seat (different color) from Target. The packaging was the same. The car seat comes in a box and only the cup holders are in a plastic bag. There is no other padding around the car seat asI was expecting and have been sued to with other models. That being said, this car seat had some light scuff marks on it in the same spots as the other car seat (from Amazon), so I'm assuming that all of these car seats have minor scuffing from the manufacturing/testing process and that it does not indicate previous use. The one I ordered from amazon did have indentions in the fabric on the side that made me think it had been used. The one from Target did not, so I am still not sure about that. The seat itself is fairly easy to install and very lightweight, but we haven't had our child in it yet, so the jury is still out on this one. I am going to contact Evenflo and let them know that their packaging for this particular car seat is somewhat off-putting and a disclaimer would be helpful to let us parents know that it is normal for the seat to arrive without being in plastic and packed in foam/Styrofoam.

Review:
My kids absolutely love these seats!! I bought these after trying a different travel size booster that my kids complained were really uncomfortable. The BubbleBums have now replaced their hard plastic seats as their daily booster.
We had an issue with one of the bladders not holding air after only a few months so I reached out to the company. They quickly replaced the bladder and gave me tips on how to keep the bladders from leaking again. You will want to always release the valve when the seat is not in use and store it either on the floor or trunk of your vehicle to keep the seals intact. My kids are old enough to release the valve and put the seats on the floor whenever we arrive at our destination.
One of the best customer service experiences that I’ve ever had. I will always recommend BubbleBum seats!

Review: We bought this for a trip we were taking to cut down on room needed in the car as we have 3 kids and the 2 youngest are still in big bulky car seats. We weren't sure how it would work for our 6 year old, but it fit really well right in between the 2 big car seats in our suv (our graco booster seat wouldn't fit). My 6 year old said it wasn't super comfortable, and it wasn't very easy for her to buckle herself in alone which is a downside for sure! I think if we used this daily, she would be able to figure it out, it's just not as simple as a traditional booster seat for a child to buckle in. But overall, it has great benefits, and I'd definitely recommend if you are tight on car space. Another slight downside is that my 6 year old couldn't see out the car windows as well since it's flat, and her usual booster has a few inches of height added.

Review: My car didn’t install well with the easy latch piece it was loose even once I tightened it . I did the seat belt install on both of my seats and worked perfectly and properly. I have a 2020 jeep renegade you can definitely fit 3 across and if you had a child not in the five point but just in the belt buckle behind the driver would be the easiest place to put that child, due to how renegades buckles are set up. I have wide hips and still fit in the back not crowded and can buckle now . I posted our original set up then our new one and these are amazing . I do prefer the britax latch  but the seat belt works great. The folding feature is nice , looks nice and is well made. It’s definitely lighter then my old britax so it would moving way easier.
