Review:
You can tell the difference in construction from most brands as soon as you pick it up. Solid, well thought out design with extras like crash helmet foam and steel skeleton. Its much more comfortable too. Lots of removable padding. My daughter is much happier sitting in this seat than the Chicco we had. The only negative features are lack of leg room and the cover doesn't come off easily for washing. The leg room is an issue when facing backward but this is probably an issue for most convertibles. This is a large seat. It barely fits in my wife's 4 door BMW 3series and leaves no room for front seat passengers. If you have anything smaller, you better do a test install before buying.
While I respect the fact that the cover is well secured, the car seat has to be uninstalled in order to remove the cover due to cleaning. This is not an easy to install car seat. Most of the difficulty directly relates to safety features built into the carseat,so that's not really a drawback. But when you have to install the seat 2x in a week because of leaking diapers, it can be frustrating.
Overall, the piece of mind, solid construction and quality make me very satisfied with the seat. In future design considerations, Britax (pay attention!) can make their seats easier to install, with more leg room and quick cover removal.

It seems to click even with the straps still loose and you have to click it multiple times when removing slack in harness. Click tight install feature is nice. Very heavy but non issue for someone who isn't removing carseat to put in another vehicle. The level indicator ball seems to stick when trying to set angle. Could be isolated issue with my one carseat. Overall solid feel, nice fabric and cushioning for little ones. Happy with purchase.

Review: This seat seems to have it all. We are a rear facing family. My 3 year old just recently got close to outgrowing his previous convertible car seat's rear facing limits, so we turned him forward. This seat's 50 lbs limit has allowed us to rear face him again and that alone is a great thing. It has great padding, is easy to install, adjust, and use. The extended leg room is AWESOME for older kids, and surprisingly does not make the seat take up too much room. The extender boot also gives us more room to load/unload him, which with an older child can be an issue with other seats. This one is so easy! We were easily able to fit it in our midsized vehicle with ease. For the limits and features that this seat has, the price is unbeatable! Can't say too many good things about it. Anything that allows kids to rear face longer, and does so comfortably at that, is always a great thing. Throw in the decent price point and it'a winner! We plan to  buy one for our youngest child, as well.

My 5 yo sat comfortably to 3 1/2 rear facing and could have even longer based on height and weight restrictions. My 2 yo is still easily rear facing. I would recommend this seat to anyone and everyone. Just be warned it is heavy

The release button is hidden underneath the fabric so you have to get your finger in the hole of the fabric and dig around to get the right angle to release it. We also have a problem with the pull cord to tighten and release the straps getting lost under the fabric. I regret buying this over the normal nextfit. If they weren't so expensive I'd throw this one out and get the normal one.

I do believe it is just as safe and comfortable for baby. Just a bigger pain for parents to use.

Review:
I have had 3 other car seats, and the Maxi Kosi Magellan by far is the nices, safeist, and well made.

This has the convenious of being a 5 in 1 car seat which converts from birth to as long as a child will be in a car seat by safety laws and regulations. Booster included.

The material is soft , sturdy, comfortable , and Very Cozy the 3 1/2 year said. This is easy to take apart for cleaning .

I had a bit of trouble getting this in my Suv as you have to make sure the head rest piece is all the way up to be able to pull the seatbelt through to latch it in.

This is a heavy car seat compared to other brands. But understandable because it is a 5 in 1 car seat.
Also you won’t be spending a lot of money buying different car seats as your child gets older, this has it all.

This also has A build in Level into the frame on the bottom side that tells you the proper way it’s sitting in your vehicle depending on what stage of the car seat your using for Your child.

The straps are All adjustable , has Two cup holders , one on each side.

There is a book that comes with this and easy instruction written on the side of the seat.

We could not ask for more on this Safe car seat for our 3 1/2 yr old.
I would buy this one again.

Review:
This is a wonderful car seat! We bought this for our toddler, whom we want to keep rear facing as long as possible because it's safer. We needed a seat that would rear face a larger child (this one is one of the tallest on the market, and up to 40 lbs), it needs to fit in my small back seat, and it needs to be less than $200.
This seat is all those things! I can put it rear facing behind my passenger seat in my Corolla, and I can sit comfortably in the front (and I'm 5'9", all legs). My son is comfortable in it, and it's SUPER EASY to use! No re thread harness, latch system makes it quick and easy to install, the recline is easy to adjust... I have honestly been very impressed with this seat. I would definitely recommend this seat, I would buy another one like it and I'm so glad I bought this seat.
The only possible downside would be that it's just shy of $200, which seems like a lot, but it's worth every penny.

Review:
This is my first ever and only Amazon review. I’ve had this car seat now for 1.5ish years and cannot say enough good things:
1. My 2-year-old is the last of her friends still rear-facing. I thought the extend2fit platform was kinda a gimmick - but it gives my daughter lots of legroom, PLUS a platform to place her toys and loveys on trips, PLUS it makes it easier for me at 5 months pregnant to fit her in the car seat.
2. We’ve had a few spills and vomit situations and it’s a breeze to clean. I take off the fabric pieces, throw them in the wash, and hose down the base.
3. I have friends who say they don’t know how to install their car seat. This is a breeze to take in and out of my car when I need to.
4. It’s comfortable! We live in Texas and the car can get super hot in a parking lot. The fabric is always cool to the touch when we get back to the car - NOT like her chicco infant seat, which I had to cover with a towel when parked in the sun.
5. This is a common feature in most car seats, but a non-rethread harness is a MUST. I can adjust the car seat for any growth spurt without even taking her out of the car!
6. Can you beat the price? I laugh at anyone who buys a $200+ car seat.

Review:
We got this seat for our 3 year old moving out of a Britax Advocate. These are our first impressions after a couple of weeks.

It was easy to install with LATCH.
It has 2 cup holders and 2 little square holes behind them from snacks, which is great.
I was worried about the armrests being in our kids way, but they seem very comfortable for him.
The harness (only used as 5-point) is easy to adjust, and has padding at the shoulders. He can almost put in on himself, the straps gets very long, but he can't open it.
Our son really likes the red accents on the seat, makes him think it looks fun, while the dark colors still make it look nice in the car.

I really like the fabric, unlike the Advocate which is cloth, this is more like a clothy polyester like fabric. It is soft and comfortable, but it feels liquid repellant, and you can easily wipe it off. Big bonus!

we have not used this as a booster yet, but so far we are very satisfied.

Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: LATCH
Harness Type: 5-point
Material: clothy polyester like fabric, soft, comfortable, liquid repellant, easy to wipe
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:

The material feels soft and comfortable, is easy to clean, and repels liquids.

Review:
Here's a quick breakdown on the pro's and con's of this seat and some simple tips on adjusting the seat.

Quick adjustment overview.

TILT adjustment: Under the front strap is a lever you pull towards you and allows you to tilt the seat to desired angle.

STRAP adjustment: To tighten PULL the front strap. to loosen push on the button hidden where the strap drops into the cushion and pull the shoulders straps at the same time.

HEIGHT: Pull the tap at the top of the seat while pushing down or pulling up on the head restraint foam part of the seat to set desired height.

PROs:

-same controls as our 4-35 Viaggio Enfant Seat so it's very easy to use if you have other Peg Perego seats
-high quality italian made cushions and fabrics
-compact size and easy to use controls
-easy to use seatbelt and tether system
-has front tether which most seats don't
-has a holder for the instruction manual so you never loose it
-tons of angle flexibility and easy to adjust

CONs:

-Manufacturer suggested 7 year life limit. My opinion is you could use the seat longer if you maintain it's condition and adhere to current child seat laws.
-instruction manual is very complex and quite thick.
-seatbelt cushions are too thick for small infants

I installed the seat in a FORD F-350 Superduty for comparison using the seatbelt as those trucks do not have latch system. I included a picture of the seat compared to a Viaggio 4-35 for comparison.

Installation Type: seatbelt, tether system, front tether, latch system
Harness Type: 
Material: cushions, fabrics

We had to use a pool noodle under the seat to get it to sit flat, and we had some trouble getting it installed because the LATCH attachments in our car were narrower than the car seat.  Once installed, the seat seems very secure.  I like how easy it is to move the shoulder straps up and down.  My only complaint is that we have a hard time getting the straps to release and loosen for getting our kids in and out.  Also, we aren't very tall, and in our mid-sized car, my husband has his seat almost against the rear-facing baby seat.  I think if we were much taller, the seats might cause a problem.

Review: I bought several carseats, kept the one I liked best (this one), and returned the others.  The cup holder being integrated is a must.  You might not think so when you have an infant but you will wish you had it later.  Very comfortable.  My son outgrew his infant carrier at 5 months so I had to switch him.  He is now almost 9 months old and about 24lbs and still loves it.  He can still see out the window and he can reach what I put in the cupholder (a toy or pacifier for example).  Adjusting the headreasts also adjusts the shoulder straps ( which is awesome- it was a whole project to adjust shoulder straps when my big kids were little).  I was also looking for a carseat that let the person in the front seat have some extra room.  You would think since I drive a Suburban it wouldn't be an issue but it was.  It's still a tight squeeze because all of these carseats are enormous when you rear-face them.  But this one was the lesser of the evils anyway.

Review:
I purchaused this seat as a replacement for a Britax Boulevard in 2015 in which was involved in an accident and had to be replaced. I did a ton of research first and decided to give this seat a try - at that time my son was 3.5 years old and was forward facing. The install on this seat is not what I would consider difficult -I read all the instructions and was able to get it installed nice and tight into our 2010 Toyota Highlander in about 10 mins.

Update - my son has been using this seat for nearly 3 years and it is great. It is made of high quality materials and is built to last - I've washed the cover a ton and it still looks like new. He loves the seat and says it is very comfortable. I recently purchaused a second one for my 15 month old and have recommended this seat to many freinds.

The one downside worth mentioning: It is heavy AF. It does fold flat and fits in the car seat travel bag nicely but it is NOT lightweight and is a bit of a pain to lug through an airport if you are traveling and gate checking the seat or installing on the plane.

I had a home birth so I had to bring him to the pediatricians office at two days old. I was petrified! I ended up adding padding to keep his head supported. I know they say that's not safe, but I had to make a judgement. It's SO thin and flimsy. An absolute joke. My son is now almost 14lbs at 2 months and the insert is still doing zero. The couple times I forgot the other padding, my heart wrenched as I watched his head rolling around the entire ride in the mirror. I do NOT recommend this seat for a newborn.

Review: My husband and I purchased this seat for our son who, at 7 months, was 20 lbs and 27 inches.  He just looked too squished in his infant seat.  He has plenty of room in this seat, almost to where he looks small again!  He seems to enjoy this seat more (he screamed in the car on most trips in the other one) as he can see out the windows now.  Our state requires him to be a year old as well as 20 lbs before he can sit front-facing so it's been nice to have that option for him while he's still stuck looking at the back of the car.  We've had the seat for just over a month now and it went in pretty easily and fits in the middle of our Acura TL but my husband can't drive if it's behind the driver's seat.  It fits really well in our MDX however, even though it is a little bulky.  That seems to be the case with most convertibles thought and we noticed the same thing with our friend's Britax when we had both seats in the TL.  We have noticed his head dropping a bit at the beginning when he falls asleep but nothing a blanket tucked in couldn't fix and he's seemed to have adjusted as it doesn't seem to be a problem any longer.  Overall, I was impressed with the reviews and safety ratings and our son seems to be comfortable in it.  The only downside is the size, which again, at rear-facing seems to be the case with most convertibles.  I would recommend this seat overall.

Review: I have been waiting for months for this product to come out.  We bought the Gemini (purple) from Babies R Us. My daughter is tall for her age (27 inches at 6 months). We had the Chicco Keyfit 30, and have used it since we brought her home from the hospital. We loved it. I did a ton of research for convertible car seats, and decided this was the best one. The seat is very heavy, but that is a good thing in my opinion. I feel like it is sturdy and safe. I installed it in my car yesterday. It took less than 5 minutes to properly install the seat. The latch system on this seat is super easy to tighten. In the past, I have sat in and kneeled in seats while pulling with all my might to get them tight enough. With this seat, all I had to do was pull each latch strap, and it was in super tight! I think that is my favorite feature so far. I also loved that it has 9 recline options. My car has pretty deep bucket seats in the back, and I didn't want to have to roll up a towel or something to get the proper recline. I didn't have any problems finding the correct angle. The bubble level feature is great! The only complaint I have is that the straps seem a little stiff, and it is a little tough to get them as tight as I like once the baby is in the seat. I feel like that problem will get better as we use the seat more. The seat is very well cushioned. I was pleased with how soft and comfy it feels. My daughter seemed comfortable in the seat. I would definitely recommend this to a friend!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: latch system, super easy to tighten, pull each latch strap  
Harness Type: straps seem a little stiff, tough to get them as tight as I like  
Material: very well cushioned, soft and comfy

Review: Very compact as advertised. Convenient and compact alternative to other booster seats on the market. I like the extra room it frees up in the row. I'm knocking it one star because it is a little tricky for my 4 year old to manage by herself. I am frequently having to bend backwards into the middle row to help her get the seat belt into and out of the side restraints. There are 3 adjustable positions, but it doesn't stay in the position. A slight bump can push it all the way in essentially trapping the strap between the adjustable restraint and the mifold itself. When my daughter is sitting on it, it is extremely difficult for her to get her finger underneath the mifold in order to press the release that allows the adjustable restraints back out in order to undo the seat belt. Perhaps later production models will fix the issue, but that is my primary complaint. I would recommend to others and would most likely buy again, especially if this issue was remedied.

Several functions on this seat do not work properly and the manual suggests " rigging " the car seat with a towel or pool noodle for proper fit in a car which just doesn't seem safe. When your child falls asleep theres a lot of head bobbing, no support for them to lean their head on in the front facing position. When I received the car seat it had no shoulder strap covers as it was pictured on the one I bought. It came in no plastic covering, just in a box. The fabric stains very easy and the cover is a pain to pull off. When the seat is set to its lowest shoulder position mine would not lock in place and there was a four finger gap between the seat and its sliding adjustable part backing. Over all I just didn't like this car seat. I returned it for the Maxi Cosi Pria 70 which was amazing and worth every penny compared to this.

Review: This car seat is the best seat out there in my opinion. I have spent many hours researching car seats for my children. I work in law enforcement and their father is in EMS so unfortunately, we are exposed to how tragic traffic collisions can become without the proper child restraints. I am hoping to become certified in the next few weeks as a CPST. With my research, I discovered that the key is a proper installation and because of this, I decided that I would buy a separate seat for each of my 2 children in each of the cars we routinely drive as well as their grandparent's vehicle. For my son who is 3.5 years old, I have owned several seats ranging from a basic Cosco front facing seat to Graco convertibles to Britax convertibles. My daughter is 7 months old and recently began to outgrow her Peg Perego infant seat. I decided to begin transitioning her to this seat in my primary vehicle and plan to purchase a couple more convertible car seats for the other vehicles over the next couple of months. I could not be happier. She is in the middle seat of my 2015 Nissan Pathfinder so I had to use a seat belt installation instead of LATCH. This made me super nervous as I was concerned about getting a secure seatbelt install, but the click tight technology has been very user friendly. She seems to be very content in the seat and a good fit. I'm not sure if budget will allow us to purchase multiple of this particular model of Britax, but I do think it was worth every penny in our primary vehicle and will be researching other similar seats thoroughly for the other seats she needs.

Review: There is something seriously wrong with this seat. I think I need to return it because it's not safe. The straps do not tighten. And it's not just because it's in the rear facing position or that he's in the seat when I'm trying to tighten. I have taken this seat out several times, looked the whole thing over, checked the manual and nothing fixes it nor addresses the issue. The straps are far too loose and even when I don't have it installed it only tightens as far as the seam on the underside of the strap. When I look on the underside there's no more strap to pull through, it's at the limit of how tight it will go. I don't know if we're missing a part? Additional straps for a smaller size?? But it's not right. My child is 20# and when it's as tight as it'll go it's still way too loose!! He can pull the straps right off his shoulders without even undoing the chest clip. It's scary! There is NO EARTHLY WAY this would work on a 5# infant if it doesn't even go small enough for a 20# toddler!!!! WTH!?! This wasn't a "cheap" seat either. I bought it only after reading tons of great reviews and safety rating, so I must have gotten a defective seat.

Review:
This car seat is a beast to install rear facing. We purchased it to replace the Graco Click Connect infant seat, because our 13 month old son had reached the height limit on it. My husband and I tried to install it in the backseat of my four door Honda Civic one night after putting our son to bed. We read the directions and used a rolled up towel to try and get the right level on the seats. My car has the latch system, but we just couldn't get the strap to pull tightly enough to keep the seat from wiggling significantly. After almost an hour, we gave up and put his old seat base back in. My husband called one of his friends (with two kids a bit older than ours, so he's an experienced car seat installer) to come over the next night. It took too grown men about half an hour of tugging, pulling and pushing to finally get the seat installed tight enough for us to feel our son would be safe sitting in it.

Also, once installed rear facing the seat's tilt can't be adjusted, so make sure you have it set to the recline level you want before installing it rear facing. I wouldn't recommend this for an infant, because I don't think it reclines enough for a baby that can't support it's own head, even with the insert. (Unless you have miraculously flat back seats.) We have it on the most reclined position, but even with a towel the tilt of my rear seats makes it so that it's sitting almost upright. Once installed, I've had no problems with the seat. It's very easy to adjust the height of the shoulder straps and to tighten and loosen the straps. Also, this seat allows the front passenger seat to go back farther than our previous infant car seat. I'd recommend getting a seat cover, to protect against any puking, accidents, or food spills, because trying to clean the seat itself is a nightmare. I look forward to when my son is old enough to sit forward facing, because I think this will make a much better forward facing seat than rear facing.

Weight Range of Child: 13 month old, height limit
Installation Type: latch system
Harness Type: shoulder straps
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:
The car seat can be used in both rear-facing and forward-facing positions.

In the Scenera he still has a couple of inches above his head, but he is coming close to the 35 lb limit. The highest strap slots are about 1/2 an inch above his shoulders.

Review:
The Graco Extend2Fit platinum convertible car seat met all my must haves! Very happy with this car seat!
Likes:
1. It can be used rear facing from 4-50lbs! Wow, that exceeds the limit on any of the previous car seats I have owned. It's important with the new recommendations to keep children rear facing for as long as possible.
2. I love the 2 built in cup holders! Yes, the seat may be wider because of it, but I love having a spot for my toddlers sippy cup and another cup holder for snacks/binkies/toys. Cup holders will fit most types of sippy cups and bottles(see photo).
3. The 'fuss free' harness holder is a great feature to keep the buckle out of the way as you put baby/toddler into seat.
4. The 'Rapid Remove' washable car seat cover is very convenient! I've had numerous diaper blowouts or accidents in my other car seats and removing the cover to wash it was a pain. This feature makes it easy to take off and wash.
5. Appears to be a very cushioned and comfortable car seat, especially for long trips.

Negatives:
1. It's wide, bulky, and not lightweight- if you are traveling via airplane this car seat is a beast. Also if you want to do 3 carseats across, this did not work width wise in my large SUV with my 2 other car seats in the backseat.
2. I'm not a fan of the Graco chest buckle. I've just used other brands and I prefer those.

Overall this is an excellent car seat that will last for a long time as your child grows. It offers the highest level of safety and more convenience features than any other car seat I have owned- very pleased!

Harness Type: fuss free harness holder, Graco chest buckle

Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The car seat should accommodate a child from infancy through toddlerhood. It should be easy to secure the child with a simple harness system. The cover should be removable for cleaning. The seat should provide a cushioned and comfortable ride.

Review: I had such high hopes for this seat. I have incredibly mixed reviews. On one hand I love some things about the seats. They are narrow and they fit two across in my Odyssey the material is so nice and soft and the colors are amazing. The designs are really the best out there. So sleek and pretty. But all that is not worth the problems I have with these seats. The harness is fraying and I've only had the seats for two months. Also the new design with the new one button chest clip is HORRIBLE! My not even 20 pound 2 year olds can undo the clips. Seeing as though they are still rear facing this is so dangerous because I don't know until I'm stopped and go to get them out! I'm pretty sure I'm going to return to amazon and exchange for the Clek fllo. I called customer service to let them know and they wanted to charge me shipping for replacement harness straps! Um, no! It's not my fault they are defective!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: fraying; new one button chest clip is horrible; can undo the clips
Material: material is so nice and soft
Seat Type: rear facing
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The harness should be durable and not show signs of wear. The chest clip should be easy to operate and secure. The material should feel nice and soft. The seat should be suitable for rear-facing installation.

Review:
I ordered Graco SnugRide for a baby shower present through a Target Gift Registry, processed through Amazon. It was shipped to me in the same thin single-ply cardboard box you buy it in stores. The box is very large and flimsy. It arrived with the box seriously dented on all sides, hardly worthy of presentation. But worse, when I opened it up, I found a 2 inch white stress line in the plastic, where apparently the beige plastic of the car seat (which seems fairly thin) was over stressed during shipping. The box had no padding inside whatsoever, the car set is simply wrapped in a plastic cover. I've done a lot of shipping, and I know you have to have 2 inches or more of padding on all sides, or double boxing, and a box this large should be double corrugated for strength.

It was convenient to be able to return the car set at a local Target store, but I was not refunded the shipping cost of $15, even though it was very clearly the faulty packaging by Amazon/Target that caused the unit to get damaged. I was also informed that Target does not carry the item in their stores, so it is only available through mail order. I'm going to try to find some other local seller.

The Super Saurus model in the Gift Registry that I ordered is apparently in the premium line of SnugRide car seats, having the "GracoPedic" foam padding for comfort (in addition to the EPS which is in all Snug Rides for safety). I wouldn't buy one of these without the GracoPedic foam. Baby should not be resting on the hard plastic (oh, well, maybe the plastic isn't that hard anyway). I think they should all come with the extra GracoPedic foam (though reportedly it doesn't hold up to washing), or at least it should be mentioned on the box. But it didn't mention the GracoPedic foam on the box, I only learned it from a review, and it is hard to tell otherwise.

For a top-rated product like this, I was not impressed by the thin plastic construction, which looks and feels cheap and flexible. more like a toy than a car safety device. And if you look at the 1-star reviews, these things can break in normal use, which I don't find reassuring. But I'm not sure what if anything is actually better than this from a safety perspective, as long as you replace it at the first sign of damage so it doesn't actually come apart in use.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Material: GracoPedic foam padding, EPS, thin plastic, beige plastic, plastic cover
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The seat provides comfortable and supportive padding for the child. The seat is lightweight and easy to handle. The seat's materials are durable and acceptable.

Review: Was trying to put this in a Toyota Tacoma.  Got it for its excellent CR scores.  Had to put it in the middle seat and the seatbelt install was a giant PITA.  The lockoffs aren't one piece with the body and the seatbelts would constantly catch right where the two piece of plastic meet.  Right when you have the seatbelt as tight as you can get it, it bunches up and you have to start over again.  I did end up getting a great workout trying to put this seat in.  Ended up returning it for a Britax Marathon.  The Chicco is large, and the only real way I could get this to fit in the double cab was the middle seat.

Review:
I bought this to use in my car for my 20 month old granddaughter that I keep every Friday. It was not any harder to install than any other car seat I have dealt with but it would not tighten enough to keep it from rocking no matter what I did. I tried the rolled up towel trick but that did not work either. My son even tried to tighten it. He ended up using the tether strap on the back of the carseat and hooking it to the front of the actual seat to keep it secured. This is in addition to using the hooks and the lap belt. I am sure it will be fine once we turn her forward facing. But I am disappointed in the fact that they advertised this one for both rear and forward facing.
But the worst part aside from not fitting tight enough is the button on the 5 point harness is the most difficult button I have ever had to deal with! It takes me 3 or 4 tries and having to use all the force I have to get this button to release. I am concerned that this is a safety issue.
The seat has a nice padded cushion and it looks comfortable. I also like the 2 cup holders. That is great for snacks on the road. It seems easy to clean also. I am so disappointed that it has been so difficult to install and the release button is such a pain.

Synthesized_Customer_Needs:

Review: You will not find an easier car seat to install and it doesn't move at all once it's in. It literally takes less then a minute to install and there is nothing to it. We have several Britax car seats and this one is the best one so far. I tried to install one of the other ones the other day and this car seat makes you spoiled with how simple it is to install. The cup holders are great and it's super comfy. My only complaint is that it is hard to tighten the belt once they are in it. In the other ones, you can tighten them in much easier and make sure that they are extra snug. You really have to pull hard to get it to tighten. Overall I am extremely happy with this seat and plan to get a second one for my husband's vehicle. You will not be disappointed with this seat plus you cannot beat the safety features on it. That is the main reason we only buy Britax. We bought it for our two year old son (our one year old got the two Britax car seats he was using). They are both in the 100th percentile for height so it's nice finding a car seat that is so spacious and he won't outgrow. Don't hesitate to buy it. It's slightly more expensive than others out there and bigger but it's comforting to know that they are in the safest car seat on the market if something happens and your kid will love it.

Review: I  have three adult children and the car seats we had for them were adequate and safe.  We also had two Britax car seats for my older grandchildren who are now 7 and 8 and 9 and 12.  Unfortunately my daughter in law discarded them saying they were no longer safe.  (Doubtful) This past April I paid $323.00 for a Britax Convertible car seat for my two new grandchildren,  and I do not like it.  We have two cars:  a Cadillac STS and a Subaru Crosstrek.  The installation of the new car seat in either car is problematic.  The biggest problem seems to revolve around the Click Tight.  For starters you need thumbs of steel to turn the lever when the seat is in the car.  In order to get the click tight to click into place you have to kneel in the car seat with your full weight which is not an easy task with so little head room and maneuver space.  It is also difficult to remove the seat so you have to kneel in the seat again to get the click tight to unclick.  This is truly a horrible device.  The leveling of the seat is also a problem.  You have to readjust it several times when you put the seat in the car which is difficult given the soft nature of the back seat.  My daughter called customer service this morning and the representative was not particularly helpful or interested in our problem.  She had my daughter bring the seat into the house and maneuver the click tight in the house while the seat was on the floor.  Well it works fine when it is on a floor but who needs a car seat that only works well in the living room.

You have to readjust it several times when you put the seat in the car which is difficult given the soft nature of the back seat.

The mechanism for securing the seat should engage and disengage easily without needing to apply full body weight in a confined space. The seat should remain properly leveled after initial adjustment without needing repeated readjustments on soft surfaces.

Review: I bought this to upgrade my 3 year old to a "big girl" seat so her baby sister could have her Chicco Nextfit seat. I wanted something to fit our budget, and after researching quite a bit, I chose this seat. It was easy to assemble out of the box, except for adjusting the crotch strap position. I fought with that sucker for a good 20 minutes. It was pretty easy to install in the van, except when I realized I needed to take it back out and adjust the straps some more. The buttons to release the anchor straps to make them long again are hard and I fought with those too. The headrest is just high enough, that I have to remove the headrest on the van's bucket seat so the car seat fits properly. Also, any downward pressure on the top of the headrest causes it to lower slightly, almost like it won't click into place. That concerns me when we move to the belt positioning mode, and we have to feed the seatbelt through the red hooks which are attached to the bottom of the headrest. Overall, it works, my daughter seems to like it, and I hope it lasts through the next kid too!

The only thing I liked was that it is light weight, which makes it easier to carry. The material also made my daughter sweat, pretty heavily.

Review:
Overall, I think this seat is great and I'd recommend it. There are parts about this seat that I really love and other parts that are frustrating - things that could easily be changed to make this seat awesome!! This seat is way too innovative and good to make it only an occasional-use / folding / "grab-and-go" seat. I believe the inventor should re-think the seat and make it a regular-use seat that focuses on ease-of-use instead of the folding & traveling aspects. What do I mean?

1. Well, we've been using this as our primary seat for our 6-year-old so we leave it permanently "installed." The word installed isn't exactly accurate since the seat isn't strapped down & latched the way a baby's car seat would be. Instead, this seat sits on the regular seat of the car & uses the seatbelt each time - but... we've been leaving the shoulder-belt strap guide always attached to the belt and the right-side of the lap belt always stays in the right lap-belt guide (the shoulder part of our seatbelt comes over our daughter's right shoulder and the seatbelt buckles next to her left hip). The problem comes when the seat slides back and folds up each time she gets out. So, everytime she gets back in the car, she needs to reposition the seat and get it to sit flat while the shoulder strap is pulling slightly upward, making the seat fold. Also, as little kids do, she sits down on the edge of the seat and then wiggles herself backward and onto the seat. This also pushes the seat back and into a semi-folded position that she needs to flatten under herself.
What do I suggest? Make the seat non-folding... or at least offer a non-folding version... or create a locking mechanism to keep it open & flat. The folding aspect is cute but only necessary when you need to toss it in a backpack or store it somewhere small. However, for regular use the whole seat is tiny already, even when it's open / flat.

2. Next issue is something a couple of other reviewers pointed out - the lap-belt guides slide inward way too easily but require you to unlock them with a tab to slide them outwards. Also, that locking mechanism tab is underneath the seat so that it can't be easily released without standing the child back up. This seems silly to me - the lap-belt guides get bumped into easily when sliding the lap belt into them and when other kids in the car are shifting around. I think that the lap-belt guides should be locking in both directions and prefer the locking tab to be accessible (if possible) from the top. Again, if we're thinking of a regular-use seat that doesn't need to easily fold up for travel, then we can re-imagine the lap-belt guides a tad. Maybe there's some adjustment that could be made to keep the lap belt in proper position in the right belt guide (in my scenario) so that when she gets back into the seat it won't require a whole repositioning?

3. The shoulder-belt guide strap - as I said above, we always leave this attached. However, when you take off the belt the shoulder-belt strap guide (that red plastic piece) just slides down and needs to be repositioned the next time our daughter gets back in. What I've been doing is inserting a section of the strap into the guide as a second layer inside the guide along with the shoulder belt. This keeps the clip of the plastic guide from slipping downward. However, again, if we re-imagine this seat as a regular-use, non-traveling seat, then maybe we can come up with something better to keep the guide from sliding down or requiring any repositioning each time the child gets back in?

Enough about my suggested changes... What do I really like about this seat?
I love that this seat is so compact - not a bulky thing that makes it absolutely impossible to fit 3 boosters or combination of boosters and baby car seats in a row!!! Our daughter has a small body that didn't require a huge area but all of the other boosters were fixed with wide seats that took up essential room for no reason. Before this seat, the booster barely squeezed into place and made buckling the seatbelt an absolute misery! Now, with the mifold, there's so much room, it's a pleasure! As I said above, the seat is so compact (and adjustable) that we can easily give up some of that in order to make it a regular-use / semi-permanent seat.

Also, I love that this adjusts for the child as opposed to the one-size-fits-all boosters that assume all children need to be boosted up a very precise amount. The adjustable width of the lap-belt guides and adjustable height of the shoulder-belt strap makes this seat great. Oh, one last thing... this child seat shouldn't be called a "booster" at all... it doesn't boost the child up but rather pulls the seatbelt down to position it correctly for the child... awesome!

Review: I don’t recommend this car seat we’ve got it because it was rated five stars and the reviews were amazing however my mother-in-law ordered the same exact car seat and we are having the same exact problems. Sometimes when you go to tighten the straps it gets jammed and you cannot tighten it it doesn’t matter how hard you pull it will not tighten you have to really loose in the entire car seat and start over and pray to God that it tightens. Me being the one who uses the car seat more than anybody else has the most problems it’s not something that I can tighten with my strength. I messaged amazon 3 times and they WONT answer me. So i missed my window to return the item. So now i am out all this money and have to go buy two more car seats. 🙄🙄🙄

Over time, I have had 7 of these seats, one being the previous model, two a current vehicle (replaced both after being re-ended), and two in my other vehicle.  The middle strap is great to keep the child from sliding down. Really stands up to the wear and tear of day to day use, and very easy to wash the covers.

Review: I just got mine unstuck! I took the whole thing out of the car to do this, but the gal on the phone said in the car might be easier so you have some leverage... anyway. Hold the top of the seat at the recline lever with one hand (pulling the lever) and with the other hand hold the bottom of the front, as if you’re going to pick up the car seat. Lift and slam down quickly! (I put a foot on the base to hold it down) When I did it, I heard a kind of click and release and the seat rotated! Then immediately put it in the right position so you don’t get it stuck again :) Hope that helps!

Review: Received my daughter's Britax Advocate 70 car seat in Serene and I am extremely happy with it! First off, we previously had the Britax B-Safe travel system when our daughter was a newborn and she's used it up until now and she is about to be 1yrs old. She can still fit in it, but I wanted to get her a new one as she's a longer and needs a little more room. It'll also be easier for me to put her in it since I'm still going to have her rear-facing in the middle of the backseat as long as possible. We've been so impressed with the quality and safety with all the Britax car seats and so I knew we would stick with Britax for many years and babies to come! The Advocate itself was clearly well made. You can feel the sturdiness in it and the quality. I chose this particular model because of the extra side-impact protection. It is definitely on the wider side, so if you have an SUV or van, this seat is ideal. While this would still fit into a smaller vehicle, other passengers in the back might be a little cramped. Anyway, be sure the read up and refer the Britax's main website for the additional safety features. In person this car seat is everything I had hoped for regarding safety, quality, longevity, and aesthetics. The serene color is perfect for our cream leather interior and for warmer climates (we travel back and forth from CA to FL) versus the darker black/gray versions. I highly recommend!!

Installation Type: rear-facing in the middle of the backseat
Material: cream leather interior, serene color
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:

When she gets taller, I suspect this will be less of an issue, but for now it's kind of a pain.  Also, the velcro parts that enable you to keep the straps open seem misaligned with the velcro on the straps themselves.

Review:
My son is going to be six and we have had this seat for 2 years. It is so easy to switch between our small car and our honda odyssey. It is also light weight so it makes switching even easier. The cloth parts are easily removed to be washed when needed. I have washed them quite a few times and so far no shrinking, rips or tears from wear or waahing. My son is an explorer so he loves the cup holders he puts his drink in own and rocks, sea shells, pinecones, small toys etc in the other. As a mom I could not be happier with this seat the price is great and it is also easily adjustable.
I saw a lot of questions about the latch belt.
This seat doesn't have the latch system. It just sits on top of your vehicles seat. A lot of people have had concerns about what to do if your child is not sitting in it and it is in the vehicle with you while driving. I drive sensibly and have never not once have the seat fly forward or move. I have also had various times where we've had to stop suddenly swerve or what have you to avoid accidents or deer. Never has this seat moved. Thanks graco.

Beautiful and sturdy car seat! My 3-year-old grandson loves it. It gives him a little boost to look tru the window. He looks comfortable and relaxed. It has a great cushion and it is wide enough to feel unrestricted. It has 3 reclining positions and it is easy to adjust, arm rest, and cup holder - just as described. Great price, good looking, and well done. I only wish it was a little more elevated from the car sit. Other than that, it is great!

Review:
This carseat is large. I have a 2006 Honda Odyssey and the carseat fits fine even for my long legged 4 year old. I don't think this would do well in a car.

Last year, we drove from Washington state to Maryland and then took another trip from Maryland to Chicago and back. I'm so glad we had these seats for my one year old and 3 year old.

The seats recline a bit so their heads don't fall awkwardly forward or to the side while they sleep.

Their are two cup holders which makes it easy to insert snacks from the front seat.

Their is a detachable pillow for added napping comfort.

I had another more expensive carseat before the big move across country. I had to borrow my sister in-laws van and I used her carseat (this one). I fell in love and bought two for my kids to travel with.

However, as you can learn from the weight designation in the product's name, it's supposed to last until 70lb. I admit, our kid is heavier and larger than average for his age. Having said that, I didn't expect at less than 40lb for him not to fit comforbaly with a jacket on. We had to remove his jacket to make him stop whimpering. The seat is wide enough and tall enough - the only problem is the short straps. Very annoying!

We just switched to a convertible booster (Britax Frontier 85), with strap-length to spare. Peace and tranquility have been restored!

I am 5'2, so not much discomfort in that regard, but my 5 year olds Diono (which I had wanted to place next to Mysize originally) had to be placed behind passenger seat. Review:
As a die hard Britax fan, I automatically bought the car seat when my son was old enough to switch from the infant carrier. The seat is very large, plush and seems to be comfortable.

It does, however, lack adequate adjustment and range of motion. It also doesn't fit in my car so it went into my wife's SUV-where it still didn't fit 'out of the box' and required a rolled up towel to be properly adjusted. Maybe it's just me but when I spend this much money for a safety seat, I shouldn't have to add anything to the seat to make it work as designed.

The area around my son's head on the seat is rather wide and doesn't provide what I'd consider to be adequate support for his head/neck when he falls asleep in the car.

After noticing these issues, I did additional research and bought a Chicco NextFit for my Mazdaspeed3, which is more compact, more comfortable for my son (he doesn't seem to thrash around as much when put into the seat or try to get out immediately after the buckle is released like he does in the Britax), and most importantly, doesn't require a rolled up towel or pool noodle to be properly adjusted. The NextFit works in both cars and is MUCH easier to adjust, install and remove as needed.

Review:
Buyer beware: this is a great car seat for traveling or fitting in smaller seat (I.e. sports car) but this seat is not FAA certified. If you read the label carefully you will read that it meets the requirements. It has to state that it is FAA certified in order to be approved for take off and landing on an aircraft.

We were told that we had to remove our child from the seat and we could not use it because the seat was not labeled with an FAA CERTIFIED sticker. We were very upset since we spent almost $400 for this “convenient” car seat to travel abroad with. There is nothing convenient about having an active toddler without a car seat on a super long international flight. Please keep this in mind if you are planning on using this car seat for flight use.

While I like the design, the portability, ease of use and travel bag, I do not recommend the seat because it lacks the certifications required to fly on most airlines.

Review: I bought this before there were any reviews and I hated to take that chance but I like Chicco products and it looked like a good option. And as portable booster seat goes, it's great: it's very compact and portable. In addition, it's a study seat so it's great for travel. However, our intention was to use it in the house and our table has about a 4" vertical "rim" under the top (there's probably a term for this but I don't know what it is") and if the booster seat is raised up at all, we can't then pull our daughter up to the table. As such, our only option is to use the booster seat in its fully-lowered position and that then raises our daughter up about 2 inches over simply sitting in the chair which leaves her sitting too low. The seat needs to have the ability to raise up to a point in between its fully-lowered position and its current lowest raised position; since it doesn't have this, it's not workable for us. We'll keep it in the car and maybe use it at restaurants but unlike some other reviewers, we're okay with restaurant high chairs (we just wipe them down) so for us, this was a bad purchase (but it's not fair to call the chair itself bad, which is why I'm giving it 3 stars).

Review:
We bought this car seat from a different source after finding a better sale price, but thought I would share my thoughts here.

Great, quality car seat that I felt met my high safety expectations, after a different high-end brand let me down (having had recalls regarding their China-made plastic and removal of their anti-rebound bar design in the new bases). I read many safety websites and comparisons regarding this car seat and other competitors', but seeing the actual results of the crash safety tests and the amount of G-Force transferred to the baby (this car seat rated among the best for dispersal of G-Force and impact energy) I felt happy going with it. The fabric looks like it will breath well and I'm impressed by the different inserts and quality of construction. The base is also narrower so it has a better fit if you want to try doing the three-across car seat setup in your truck or car. My husband loves that the seatbelt lockoff is a big panel that easily pushes down instead of those flimsy narrow lockoffs you see on other car seats. I love the European belt routing if you're installing without the base. Honestly, it's everything I've come to expect from a modern car seat.

Cons:
The shoulder pads - someone else mentioned that the velcro is sewn on the inside where the fabric meets the harness belts, and it is still this way with the one we purchased. It catches on EVERYTHING, including the harness belts themselves at times. We tried different dolls and stuffed animals in the car seat for fun, my children enjoy it, but I have to be careful they don't get caught by this velcro. I can foresee issues with this and will probably remove them and use a different brand or something. They are great material other than this one design flaw.

The canopy - it's a great UPF protected canopy made of breathable fabric, again quality materials. but it CLICKS loudly into place once fully extended, and I can see this startling a baby. Also, as many others have mentioned, the clearance for your hands is barely there while trying to carry. Honestly, I bought the car seat anyway knowing this and having seen it in many videos. I am not bothered by it as much because the car seat is so light and easy to handle that I don't need to do too much "manhandling." I'm sure my husband might disagree with his bigger hands, but we will see.

I'm happy I went with it, and look forward to lots of road trips! The car seat should last past baby's first year!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: seatbelt lockoff, European belt routing
Harness Type: shoulder pads, harness belts
Material: fabric, breathable fabric, quality materials
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:

It should be easy to install using a seatbelt lockoff and European belt routing.  
The harness should include shoulder pads and harness belts for comfort and security.

Review:
This is the second car seat I have ordered of this make. After reading and hearing reviews I felt it was an excellent buy. We purchased one for my daughter in Jan 2013 and now I needed one for my son (3 years old and 33 pounds). They both found it comfortable and love having cup holders. It is easy to install securely as a car seat in our Crossover vehicle and also to get my kids securely fastened. The only thing I didn't like about it was after we converted it to a high back booster for my daughter. We found it too difficult to get her buckled up and the belt where it needed to be. The reach around the seat was awkward because of the width and she could not do it herself. We ordered her the Evenflo Big Kid Amp (which she loves) and it is much easier to deal with. My son's was ordered after we already switched my daughter into the Amp.

In terms of delivery of this item, I was having troubles finding them in stores and was worried about the "usually ships in 3-6 weeks" that I found on the listing. I phoned Evenflo and they told me that a shipment was scheduled to arrive at Amazon's warehouse on April 15. I was beyond impressed (and surprised) to have my son's new car seat sitting on my porch by 10am on April 18th. And the box itself didn't have a single mark on it. Well done Amazon.

Review: Just bought these for my 4yo and 2yo. I had 2 gracos before these which were also great but these dionos are so nice and slim! I have a Chevy Cruze and with the Gracos I had no extra back seat space and now there is more room! The dionos also sit lower which I like because they can easily get in and out of them. I love the memory foam like seat cushion on the dionos, very soft and feels comfortable! Installing it was as easy to install as any other car seats. It took me a second to find the instructions, they’re kind of hidden along the back of the car seat. I don’t know about the easy to clean part since I haven’t had to clean them yet but while installing it I noticed the little clasps around the seat that look easy enough to undo to wash the cover.

She looked so awkward and she is broad shouldered like me so I feel like she looked somewhat squished. It’s a shame because I really wanted to like this car seat due to all the features, but I got the Maxi Cosi Magellan 5 in 1 instead and love that so much better!

Review:
I researched car seats extensively before buying this seat. I decided I did not want to spend $300 on a Britax. Out of the seats that got respectable safety and quality ratings and reviews, this one had the highest shoulder strap slots (I literally measured several seats myself). By the time my daughter turned four she was 43 inches tall but only 37 pounds. Major problem: her shoulders were too high for the five point harness, the shoulder straps of which were now just below her shoulders, but the car seat isn't supposed to be used as a booster seat with the car's seat belt until the child is 40 pounds. The car seat is useless until she grows, creating a gap in use.

LATCH Problem: There is a secondary strap sewn to the main LATCH strap that keeps the LATCH strap looped through the correct part of the back of the seat, but in a Ford Focus, a Chevy Suburban and a Mitsubishi Montero it is in the way of properly tightening the strap so I had to use the car's seat belt and a locking clip in those cars. The LATCH strap does work in my Honda Odyssey.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 40 pounds
Installation Type: LATCH, seat belt
Harness Type: five point harness
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:
The car seat should be forward facing.  
The car seat should accommodate a child weighing up to 40 pounds.  
The car seat should be installable using LATCH or a seat belt.  
The car seat should have a five-point harness.

That worked fairly well. Only thing that I struggle with is my kid's head falling forward when she sleeps.

Review:
My child outgrew his baby bucket car sear and I needed a new one. This seat meet all the safety requirements, and has a ton of inserts, in case I get trapped into having a second baby with the woman. I have a Toyota FJ Cruiser and this, in it's rear-facing state is a nightmare to get the kid in. I do not blame the car seat, the seat is excellent, It's my fault for trying to hold on to my fun vehicle when I should have bought something more practical for children at this stage in my life. I just love the car and I don't want to give it up. You cant make me. It's mine baby... No. Wait...

In any event, this is about the car-seat and not my personal Peter-Pan / Man-Child issues... The car seat is great. The baby fits comfortably in it and he is safe. I think he will be in this one until he is big enough to sit right on the main seat. I think US Federal law states you need to be in a car seat until age 16...

Review:
Why do I HATE this thing???

1) INSTALLATION: First off, if you anything other than a flat, bench-style backseat it is a HUGE pain to install. I even took it to the fire station and they said that this was one of the most difficult installs (I have a Nissan Rogue) that they've ever done. Additionally, the instructions for using the rear-facing install are ridiculous. After about an hour, the installers decided it was safer to just use the seatbelt instead of the LATCH system. Even in my parent's truck, which is completely flat, when I use the LATCH system, the belt invariably gets twisted and you its a bear to use the release latch.

2) UNCOMFORTABLE: Even with towels and noodles underneath, this thing is at such a weird angle that when my daughter sleeps her head flops to a 90 degree angle from her body. ALSO... the button part of the harness pushes into her belly whenever I tighten her into the seat.

3) HARNESS: The harness catches about every other time that I put her in it. I already contacted customer service for this once and got a replacement, but the new one does the same thing. I end up having to finagle her out of the seat without releasing it and then pressing the release with one hand and jerking on the straps with the other.

OVERALL- this is a ridiculously uncomfortable, behmoeth, or a pain in the neck seat and if I could just afford a new chair this thing would be out of my life so fast and I wouldn't miss it for a mili-second.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: Installation is difficult, especially on non-flat backseats; instructions for rear-facing install are ridiculous; installers used seatbelt instead of LATCH system; LATCH system causes belt to twist and release latch is hard to use.
Harness Type: Harness catches frequently; release mechanism is problematic; requires jerking straps to release.
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The car seat should be easy to install, even on non-flat backseats. Clear and straightforward instructions for rear-facing installation are needed. The installation process should work well whether using the seatbelt or the LATCH system. The LATCH system should not cause the belt to twist, and the release latch should be easy to use. The harness should operate smoothly without catching. The harness release mechanism should be reliable and not require jerking the straps to function.

Review:
Bought 2 of these car seats (one red, one blue) for our 9 month old twins, since they are outgrowing their carriers. I was willing to pay the higher cost because these are by far the most narrow seats I could find. We have 5 kids total...3 in car seats and another in a booster. Fitting it all in our van gets tricky. But the narrow design was really helpful. The seats are really heavy so I don't recommend if you're going to be moving them around a lot or swapping cars a lot. But you can tell they're well made. I also like that everything has its own little storage place. So if your not using a certain strap it's tucked away neatly, not just floating about.
I'm considering purchasing another for our 4 year old who's still in a car seat, especially since she can use it as a booster as well.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 9 month old, 4 year old
Material: well made
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The car seat should accommodate children from infancy through toddler years. It should be durable and constructed with high-quality materials.

Installation was very easy. The latch system is simple with pull tabs in the front. I'm very happy with this purchase.

Review: Easy to install in the car.  However, the straps are a bit difficult to adjust.  Our infant seat's straps were so much easier to put on and adjust than this convertible car seat's straps.  The button you have to push to loosen the straps is way, way down in a skinny tunnel -- it's kind of hard to access in a hurry.  The straps just seem to fall down where they are hard to get around your kid and the push button for unlatching the straps between the child's legs is hard to press.  My 74 year-old mom definitely struggles to get my son out of the car seat.

Review: I love my 4 year old son's new Frontier. I purchased this for him on sale just before Christmas and he loved the box it comes in just as much as his new "booster seat". We still use it as a car seat but I love the fact that he can use it for many years to come. I also love the two cup holders. We recently took a long distance car trip from Colorado to California and he was able to sleep in his Frontier comfortably without any issues. I really have no complaints about this car seat/booster seat except that, like another reviewer commented, it is a pain in the butt to pull off the cover to wash. This fact does not in any way detract from the fact that I feel like my son is safe and comfortable in his Frontier.

Review: I would have given this car seat a much better review until last week.  The plastic on the horizontal buckles has warped.  It is almost impossible to snap them together and unsnap them. This has been annoying at the least and turned dangerous when my son was leaned back throwing up while sitting in the seat and I could not get the buckle separated for a good 30 seconds, that's a very long time in a situation like that, especially when it should take no more than 1 second to unsnap the buckle.  I continue to manipulate the plastic so that the male and female parts fit better but it continues to be very difficult to snap and unsnap this buckle. Something needs to be done by Graco to rectify this situation.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: The plastic on the horizontal buckles has warped, making it almost impossible to snap and unsnap them.
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The harness buckles are easy to snap and unsnap.

Review:
We love this car seat and so does our son! His first time using it was an 8 hour car ride and he just stared out the window the whole time - loving how upright he could sit! He has GERD so a comfortable upright chair was important.

My favorite part so far is how easy it is to take it in and out of the car. It has a simple release button that takes all the hassle, struggle and pain out of unclipping regular car seats!

I would definitely recommend this car seat. Looking forward to getting a lot of use out of it!
